column1: Will Turnaround Efforts Help FireEye to Recover in 2017?;12/30/2016;"Once investors' darling in the cyber security space
column2: things have not been in favor ofFireEye Inc.FEYEfor a while now. The stock is likely to close in the red once again this year
column3: continuing its downfall for the third consecutive year.Historical PricesOn the very first day of its trade on the Nasdaq (Sep 20
column5: the stock closed at $36
column6: which was 80% higher than the Initial Public Offering (IPO) price of $20. The company ended the year 2013 on a strong note with its share prices increasing to $43.61.FireEye's shares shot up to as high as $86 in Feb 2014 on rumors of its merger with privately-held security software firm
column7: Mandiant. However
column8: shares fell drastically as the deal didn't materialize and never went even close to the Dec 31
column9: 2013 closing price. In 2014
column10: the stock lost almost 28%.The downfall continued in 2015 too with shares of FireEye declining 34%. Notably
column11: at yesterday's closing price of $11.82
column12: the stock has lost 67% from its first day trade and 41% from its IPO price.So far this year
column13: FireEye has lost 43% compared with the Zacks categorizedInternet Softwareindustry's average negative return of just 6.3%.What Went Wrong with FireEye?Over the past several quarters
column14: the company has been losing business to its rivals. FireEye faces stiff competition from other well-established players in the cyber security space which includes CiscoCSCO
column15: Check Point SoftwareCHKPand Palo Alto NetworksPANW. These players have deals with large numbers of security vendors and have broader product portfolio
column16: giving them a competitive advantage over FireEye.Furthermore
column17: the company's top-line growth has also been affected due to its futuristic approach toward transitioning itself to the cloud and shifting its business model from hardware centric to subscription-based services. It should be noted that the company generates higher initial sales from hardware than the subscriptions.Due to the aforementioned factors
column18: the company's top-line growth rates have been slowing down as evident from its last quarterly results. During third-quarter 2016
column19: FireEye's year- over-year revenue growth rate slowed down to a meager 12.6% from 45.6% and 165.1% registered in third-quarter 2015 and 2014
column20: respectively. Additionally
column21: the company's revenue growth guidance of just 1% to 4% for fourth-quarter 2016 reflects its limited growth prospects.Furthermore
column22: the company's bottom-line results failed to please as well. Since Sep 2013 when it was debuted on the stock markets
column23: the company has not been able to report profits in even a single quarter. In fact
column24: FireEye's GAAP loss has widened on a year-over-year basis.Going ahead
column25: negative operating cash flow remains a major headwind for FireEye
column26: which may hinder the execution of its growth plans. In the first three quarters of 2016
column27: the company generated negative operating cash flow of $21.5 billion. Considering the projections given by FireEye for the fourth quarter
column28: the company is expected to end 2016 with a negative operating cash flow between $41 million and $51 million.Turnaround EffortsTo counter the aforementioned challenges
column29: FireEye has taken a number of initiatives. Early this year
column30: it acquired iSIGHT Partners to strengthen its current product lineup and offer an intelligence-led security model for enterprises of any size that other security providers will find difficult to match.FireEye has also taken over Invotas
column31: a firm specializing in improving response times post a cyber-attack. Its product
column32: Security Orchestrator
column33: is designed to compile information from a range of security products and automate responses when an incident occurs.The company has launched FireEye Essentials
column34: a lower-cost and simpler version of the FireEye Global Threat Management platform. It is targeting smaller
column35: mid-market companies with the new offering.Furthermore
column36: last month it has launched new Cloud MVX and MVX Smart Grid offerings
column37: a lower cost intelligent threat detection solution for large enterprises as well as mid-market businesses.Also
column38: FireEye is focusing on cost cutting initiatives
column39: which include the layoff of 300 to 400 workers to boost its bottom-line performance. Through these initiatives
column40: it intends to generate annualized cost savings of approximately $80 million.Though shifting its business model to subscription-based services will generate lower revenues initially but the same will be stable in the long-run as organizations usually renew their subscriptions with the existing products or even with higher versions. Moreover
column41: subscription-based services generate higher gross margins.All these indicate FireEye's efforts to move beyond the enterprise level and end-point protection products it had started off with. These factors are also likely to aid the company's long-term results.Bottom LineWe believe that the company's turnaround efforts will yield results in the long run. Given the positive earnings estimate revisions over the last 60 days and its Zacks Rank #2 (Buy)
column42: we are optimistic about FireEye's recovery in 2017.You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy)   stocks here.Zacks' Best Private Investment IdeasIn addition to the recommendations that are available to the public on our website

You can even look inside exclusive portfolios that are normally closed to new investors. Starting today

column1: Juniper's Year In Review: Product Revenues Stagnate
column2: Profits Impacted;12/29/2016;"IT hardware vendors have observed a slowdown in product sales over the last couple of years
column3: with networking giant Juniper (JNPR) witnessing a similar trend across its product lines. Juniper has reported strong revenue growth for its network switches over the years while core routing revenues have stagnated in the same period. On the other hand
column4: Juniper has struggled in the network security domain with a double digit revenue decline over the last few years. As a result
column5: combined product sales have been roughly flat over the last few years. The trend has continued in 2016 thus far with theservices division driving much of the top line growthfor the company. Moreover
column6: the services segment has become more profitable for the company while falling hardware prices have compressed the product segment's margins. Below we take a look at how Juniper Networks has performed this year.Unimpressive Numbers For Network Security
column7: RoutingmakeArticleAd();Juniper's core routing revenues have witnessed limited growth over the last few years with a CAGR of 1% from 2011 through 2015. This trend continued in 2016 with revenues falling by 1% through the first three quarters of the year to $1.7 billion. More worrying for the company has been its network security segment
column8: which has posted an 11% annual decline in revenues over the last few years. Network security revenues through the first three quarters of the year were down by 26% to under $240 million. In the same period
column9: competing networking company Cisco (CSCO) reported 4% y-o-y growth in network security revenues to $1.6 billion. (Read:Cisco's 2016 In Review: Higher Profits Despite Revenue Slowdown)On the other hand
column10: Juniper's switching segment has performed well this year with revenues rising by 9% y-o-y to $607 million through the first thee quarters of the year. The company has witnessed strong demand for its new QFX product line from various cloud providers
column11: telecom customers
column12: cable providers and Federal government agencies. In the most recent quarter
column13: the company reported a 50% annual increase in revenues generated by sales of the QFX switch product line.Low product sales have led to discounted selling prices
column14: which ultimately drove down product margins over the last few years. The adjusted gross margin for the product divisions combined has fallen from under 67.6% in 2011 to around 65.3% in 2015. This has further compressed to 62.4% this year. On the other hand
column15: the company's services gross margin has improved by almost 2 percentage points to 62.1% through the first three quarters of the year due to a higher rate of maintenance contract renewals and a higher proportion of services-based networking solutions on offer. Management targets a long-term gross margin of around 64% in the coming quarters
column16: which can be achieved by higher sales volumes and a high attach rate of customers in the services segment.Despite an improvement in services gross margin
column17: the company-wide gross margin was down by almost a percentage point to 62.3% through the first three quarters of the year. Additionally
column18: Juniper's operating expenses in the same period increased by around 3% to $1.64 billion as shown below. Resulting earnings per share were down by around 5% over the comparable prior year period to $1.04.Juniper's management expects the trend from the first three quarters of the year to continue through the December quarter as well. Net revenues could grow at a steady 2% to $1.35 billion
column19: with the most revenue growth coming from switching product sales and the services division. Gross margin could compress by around 80 basis points to around 63% as shown below. In an attempt to improve profitability and earnings per share
column20: management mentioned that the company aims to improve its cost structure in coming quarters. For December quarter
column21: operating expenses are expected to fall by 9% y-o-y to around $510 million. If the company can successfully reduce operating expenses in the fourth quarter
column22: Juniper's full year EPS could be around 3% higher than 2015 levels at $1.66 per share.We have a$25 price estimate for Juniper
column23: which is around 10% lower than the current market price. Juniper's stock price has fluctuated between $22 and $32 this year. You can modify the interactive charts in this note to gauge how a change in individual drivers can have on our price estimate for Juniper.See Full Analysis For Juniper Here0View Interactive Institutional Research (Powered by Trefis):Global Large Cap|U.S. Mid & Small Cap|European Large & Mid CapMore Trefis   Research"

column1: Should I Buy Nokia Corp (ADR) (NOK) Stock? 3 Pros
column2: 3 Cons;12/29/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNokia Corp(ADR)(NYSE:NOK) stock has gained a little over 10% in the last two months after experiencing a bit of a rally. However
column4: looking at the picture for the entire year
column5: Nokia stock is still off 31% year-to-date. The fact is that despite the recent comeback
column6: NOK stock still faces several tough fundamental challenges.Source:Open Grid Scheduler / Grid Engine via Flickr (Modified)Consider that NOK's outlook for next year calls for a 2% decline in the networking business. It's important to note that telecom carriers have been holding off on purchases because they have already spent substantial amounts on upgrading their networks to 4G technologies.makeArticleAd();There is also weakness in emerging markets. In fact
column7: with the surge of the dollar
column8: the problems may get even worse. All of this is kind of grim
column9: right? But when it comes to investing
column10: a contrarian approach can certainly lead to nice profits.So does Nokia stock fit the bill? Perhaps the company is poised for a turnaround? Well
column11: let's take a look.Three Pros to Owning Nokia StockInnovation: Nokia Technologies is the segment that focuses on consumer and professional technology offerings
column12: such as those for digital health and media. Although
column13: for the most part
column14: much of the growth has been from licensing its extensive patent portfolio.The 7 WORST Stocks to Buy for 2017But NOK is certainly investing aggressively with its own innovations. For example
column15: the company has developed a sophisticated virtual reality system for professionals. One of the marquee clients isSony Corp(ADR)(NYSE:SNE)
column16: which has had lots of success with its PlayStation VR platform.In addition to this
column17: Nokia is making another play for the smartphone market. The device is called theNokia P
column18: which is based onAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column19: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system and will be manufactured byHon Hai Precision Industry Co. Ltd.(OTCMKTS:HNHPF). Granted
column20: the smartphone market is brutally competitive. But it is encouraging that NOK is taking some risks. Besides
column21: the company has a lot of experience marketing technologies in developing countries.Nokia stock has also been getting more adventuresome with mergers and acquisitions. Just look at the deal for Withings. The company is a pioneer in the connected health market
column22: such as with digital weighting scales
column23: activity trackers and baby monitors. According to NOK's own research
column24: the market is expected to grow at a compound annual rate of37% from 2015 to 2020.Network: NOK has a high-performance
column25: end-to-end platform
column26: covering mobile networks
column27: fixed networks
column28: IP/optical networks
column29: applications and analytics. Because of this
column30: the company has been able to sell to a wide assortment of customers
column31: such as in verticals like energy
column32: the public sector and transportation. What's more
column33: the recent acquisition of Gainspeed has been important in attracting cable operator customers too.But the real play is for 5G mobile networks. According to areportfromTelefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson(NASDAQ:ERIC)
column34: the market is expected to hit 550 million users by 2022. A key driver will be the megatrend of the Internet of Things
column35: which involves wireless connections among devices
column36: as well as video and VR.According toInvestorPlace.com's Dana Blankenhorn: ""If you get into Nokia now
column37: you're catching the next wave of network spending at its bottom
column38: and can ride that wave to profit. That is the bull case
column39: and while that might take some time to prove out
column40: it's a good bet carriers will spend again in the next three to five years.""Dividend and Fiscal Disciplne: With the transformative acquisition of Alcaltel Lucent
column41: NOK is expected to generate savings of €1.2 billion per year. And these may ultimately prove to be fairly conservative. If anything
column42: NOK has shown a great ability to be disciplined with its cost structure.In other words
column43: margins are likely to expand over time
column44: especially as the network business starts to recover.In the meantime
column45: investors will likely enjoy a competitive dividend
column46: which is at nearly 6%.Three Cons to Owning Nokia StockHistory and Brand: NOK has a storied history. Back in the late 1980s
column47: the company realized the potential of the mobile industry and started to develop its own devices. Nokia was also critical in establishing the core standards for wireless systems. So by the end of the 1990s
column48: the company was one of the most valuable tech operators in the world.But unfortunately
column49: NOK failed to keep up the innovation
column50: which allowedApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) and GOOGL to dominate the market. By 2012
column51: Nokia stock sunk below $2 a share and it looked like survival was in doubt.So yes
column52: it is remarkable that the company has been able to get some stability and invest in growth. But then again
column53: when it comes to turnarounds in the tech industry
column54: the success rate is usually not so good. It is incredibly tough to catch up - and there is always the tarnishing of the brand. After all
column55: how many people want to buy a product from a company that seems like a has-been?Competition: Even with the consolidation
column56: the networking business remains highly competitive. Granted
column57: some of the rivals are not particularly strong
column58: such as Ericsson. But these kinds of companies can still be very problematic since they are often tempted to engage in price wars.Although
column59: for NOK stock the biggest threat could be from the operators in China
column60: like Huawei and ZTE. They not only have the benefit of low-cost platforms but also preferential access to their home markets.Moreover
column61: growth has been strong. For the first half of this year
column62: the revenues of Huawei spiked by40% to $36.8 billion. Then again
column63: the company has a diversified revenue base
column64: which not only includes the sales of networking equipment but also smartphones (ranked No. 3 in the world).Currently
column65: NOK has the second highest market share for wireless infrastructure equipment
column66: at about 26%. This compares to Huawei's 23%. However
column67: given the company's growth ramp
column68: it probably won't be long until it becomes the world leader.Should You Buy Cisco Systems
column69: Inc. (CSCO)     Stock? 3 Pros
column70: 3 ConsPatents: Licensing of intellectual property has been the only growth driver for Nokia stock. In thelatest quarter
column71: this business helped ignite a 109% increase in sales for the Nokia Technologies division. The run-rate for the year is expected to hit €950 million.But there is a big issue: About€150 millionof existing licensing revenues will expire this year. This is one of the reasons NOK has beenramping up its legal efforts.Yet this type of litigation can be time consuming and unpredictable. And even if there is a win
column72: it can still take years of appeals to get any resolution. More importantly
column73: AAPL is known to be a tough fighter when it comes to IP claims.Bottom Line On Nokia StockWhile the long-term prospects of 5G look promising
column74: it will take time for the market to get going. Customers will certainly try to find ways to delay the heavy investments and try to find ways to keep leveraging the existing networks. There are also the intense competitive forces that will weigh on margins.In the meantime
column75: NOK stock must deal with other problems
column76: such as the expiration of a bulk of the licensing business. If the company is unable to manage this
column77: the revenue impact will definitely be significant.So given all this
column78: the cons outweigh the pros - even though Nokia stock does sport a compelling dividend yield.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbookand is a registered investment adviser representative (you   canvisit his siteto learn more about his financial planning services).He is also the author of various books on investing like All   About Commodities
column79: All About Short Selling and High-Profit IPO   Strategies.Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column80: he did not hold a position in any of the   aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Stocks That Won't Be Around a Year From     Now7 Beaten-Down Tech Stocks to Buy With 50%     Upside in 2017The postShould I Buy Nokia Corp (ADR) (NOK) Stock? 3 Pros
column81: 3 Consappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column10: in trading today Wells Fargo & Co. (Symbol: WFC) is down about 0.4%
column11: Cisco Systems
column12: Inc. (Symbol: CSCO) is up about 0.3%
column13: and General Electric Co (Symbol: GE) is up by about 0.3%.For a complete list of holdings

column15: versus its 200 day moving average:Looking at the chart above

column17: with $103.53 as the 52 week high point - that compares with a last trade of $101.75. Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column18: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column19: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column20: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column21: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column22: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: Should You Buy Cisco Systems
column2: Inc. (CSCO) Stock? 3 Pros
column3: 3 Cons;12/29/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt has been an exciting year forCisco Systems
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO) shareholders. The company started to change course following longtime CEO John Chamber's exit last year. Chuck Robbins took the reins last July
column6: and has refocused the company's strategy toward the cloud. Robbins has acquired many businesses in that space. 2016 delivered better results for CSCO stock
column7: and 2017 is shaping up nicely
column8: as analysts forecast renewed strength in networking.Source:Prayitno via Flickr (Modified)Add it all up
column9: and Cisco stock finally got some traction. After trading essentially flat for the past decade
column10: CSCO stock is up 12% in 2016. Can the good times continue heading into next year?makeArticleAd();CSCO Stock ConsTransitional Challenges: Cisco
column11: like many older tech companies
column12: relies on legacy technologies. Older inventions still drive much of CSCO's profits and cash flow. Consider switching
column13: for example. This segment accounts for almost a third of Cisco's sales
column14: yet it is declining at a high single-digit rate. Thus
column15: it needs to find a lot of growth in other areas to make up for the steady erosion of its top offering. Bulls can counter this point by showing other segments
column16: such as security
column17: that rose at a double-digit rate. But these gains come from a small starting base
column18: and are often in areas with more aggressive competition.Cisco is indeed making the right moves with big pushes in cloud
column19: security and services. However
column20: at least for the next couple of years
column21: these appear merely sufficient to offset declines elsewhere
column22: rather than powering the company as a whole to meaningful growth. There are worse positions in the world than sitting on $70 billion in cash while milking cash cow legacy businesses. However
column23: for strong CSCO stock performance in the future
column24: these newer initiatives need to replace the current fading divisions.Eroding Position Competitively: While Cisco's longer-term results still seem fairly strong
column25: there are worrying signs. Gross margins
column26: for one. Cisco generated gross margins in excess of 70% in 2003
column27: and traditionally earned high 60s margins last decade. These slipped to the high 50s recently
column28: before rebounding modestly in 2016. Falling margins indicate a slipping competitive position. Other companies are hitting Cisco on pricing and taking away the company's profitability.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017The company's return on assets has also dropped sharply. It traditionally ran around 14% to 15% prior to the Great Financial Crisis. In recent years
column29: this has fallen into the single digits
column30: and sits at about 9% currently. This reflects the company's inability to convert profits into new opportunities. Whether this is because the company has cash tied up overseas or simply due to a lack of investment opportunities
column31: it leads to poor returns on CSCO stock. A company that can't find attractive uses for its cash will struggle to deliver strong returns.China Risk: Cisco generates almost half of its revenues outside of the U.S. Given President-elect Trump's threats to target China specifically and trade in general
column32: Cisco is more vulnerable than many to a trade war.Many of the products that Cisco makes can be copied by cheaper Asian competition. Companies such asHuaweiwould love to take more market share away from Cisco. And in a scenario where various countries start throwing retaliatory tariffs back at the U.S.
column33: it would put Cisco in an unfavorable position. Combine that with the worsening overvalued U.S. dollar issue
column34: and Cisco may have issues internationally.CSCO Stock ProsCash Coming Home: Cisco currently operates with a gigantic cash pile. The company counts more than $70 billion in cash and short-term marketable securities. The vast majority of this is held off-shore to avoid taxation on profits. Should Trump get his way
column35: it appears that there would be a tax break
column36: allowing companies such as Cisco to bring their money back to the U.S.Given that Cisco's whole market cap is just $150 billion
column37: it's clear that having more than $60 billion in newly available cash could unlock real value in CSCO stock. Whether the company uses it to boost the already solid dividend
column38: buy back stock or make acquisitions
column39: any such avenue is likely to produce better results than the current situation.Relatively Cheap: Cisco stock currently trades around 15x earnings and 13x forward earnings. That compares quite favorably to the tech industry as a whole. Although if you view CSCO as a so-called tech utility - with much less growth - the valuation is about what you'd expect.That said
column40: Cisco stock has proven itself capable of continuing to grow at a modest clip. The company has grown revenues at a compounded 7.5% rate over the past 10 years. And free cash flow has advanced 6.6% annually over that same span. Given the general overvaluation in the U.S. stock market
column41: a company trading at 15x earnings with 6% to 7% growth rates over the longer haul isn't a bad idea.Big Dividend: The 3.4% dividend makes CSCO stock the single highest yielding mega-cap tech company in the U.S: 3.4% places it just ahead ofInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) at 3.36%. Cisco has grown the dividend at a 22% annualized rate over the past five years
column42: and raised it 20% this past year.Should I Buy International Business Machines     Corp. (IBM) Stock? 3 Pros
column43: 3 ConsOf course
column44: a good chunk of that came from the rising dividend payout ratio. The company has elected to return more cash to shareholders. That said
column45: over the last couple of years
column46: the dividend payout ratio has stabilized
column47: while the dividend continues to rise. Should the cash repatriation plans come into effect
column48: CSCO should have plenty of runway to keep raising the dividend at a strong clip for years to come.Bottom Line on Cisco StockCSCO stock is one of the U.S.' cheapest large tech companies. And it has some growing divisions to pick up the slack for its fading legacy operations. The dividend is large
column49: growing and defended with a strong balance sheet. However
column50: should Cisco's acquisitions and growth strategy fail to play out
column51: the stock could end up dead money
column52: offering little more than the dividend.At the time of this writing
column53: Ian Bezek owned CSCO stock and   IBM stock. You can reach him on Twitter at @irbezek.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best S&P 500 Stocks of 2016The 7 Best Monthly Dividend Stocks for 2017The postShould You Buy Cisco Systems

column1: FireEye Inc's Best Moves in 2016;12/28/2016;"I've generallybeen bearishonFireEye(NASDAQ: FEYE)
column2: the once-promising cybersecurity firm that lost   over 40% of its value in 2016. The company's declining revenue   growth
column3: widening GAAP losses
column4: unstable cash flow
column5: and executive   exodus all indicate that the stock could fall further next year.   However
column6: those challenges shouldn't completely overshadow its   accomplishments this year. Let's take a look back at three of   FireEye's smartest moves in 2016.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();1. Appointing Kevin Mandia as its new CEOFireEye's future looked bleak after CEO David DeWalt abruptly   announced his  resignation earlier this year. After all
column7: DeWalt had led FireEye for over four years
column8: and helped establish   its ""best-in-breed"" reputation in threat detection solutions.   DeWalt was also willing to sell FireEye
column9: which would have given   its investors a quick exit opportunity.However
column10: appointing FireEye President Kevin Mandia as DeWalt's   successor was a smart move. Mandia founded Mandiant
column11: the   cybersecurity company that revealed that an elite Chinese hacking   group was targeting U.S. government and corporate systems in   2013. FireEye acquired Mandiant for about $1 billion the   following year
column12: and its machine-based security tech plays a   central role in its threat prevention services.Mandia's transition from president to CEO has been fairly   smooth. Mandiareportedly isn't interested in selling FireEye.   Instead
column13: he'll likely focus on improving its long-term growth and   profitability instead of profiting from a quick sale. Under   Mandia the company also decided to lay off 300 to 400 of   FireEye's 3
column14: 400 workers.That move -- along with other cost-cutting initiatives -- are   aimed at reducing FireEye's annual costs by $80 million. We   already saw some progress last quarter
column15: when its GAAP net loss   narrowed $0.13 from the prior-year quarter to $0.75 per share.   That bottom-line improvement is rare in the cybersecurity   industry. Next-gen firewall vendorPalo Alto Networks(NYSE: PANW)
column16: for example
column17: saw its GAAP loss widen from $0.47 to   $0.69 per share last quarter.2. Expanding FireEye as a cloud-based serviceFireEye's sales growth slowed down due to waning demand for   its on-site appliances and rising demand for its cloud-based   services. That shift has been tough
column18: since FireEye generates much   more revenue on the initial sale of an appliance than gaining new   subscriptions. But over time
column19: these cloud-based subscriptions   become more dependable sources of long-term revenue.FireEye's main product for this market is FireEye as a Service   (FaaS)
column20: which continuously detects and analyzes threats without   the need for large security teams or managed security services   providers. In November
column21: FireEye expanded that ecosystem with   Cloud MVX and MVX Smart Grid
column22: which adds new private
column23: hybrid
column24: and   public cloud deployment options for mid-sized and larger   businesses.Mandia noted that these products still represented the ""early   phases of the richest new innovation cycle in our history
column25: as   the cloud-based products would help ""customers elevate their   security profile at a lower total cost of ownership.""3. Turning FireEye into an all-in-one platformIn late November
column26: FireEye introduced Helix -- an all-in-one   platform that bundles its network
column27: endpoint
column28: Threat Analytics   Platform
column29: Advanced Threat Intelligence
column30: and FireEye Security   Orchestrator together in a unified system with  a single   user interface. From that interface
column31: users can add additional   services like FaaS
column32: email
column33: other threat detection tools
column34: and even   integrate the platform with third-party threat intelligence   tools.This platform serves as the foundation of a ""FireEye   ecosystem
column35: which widens its moat against tech giants likeCisco(NASDAQ: CSCO)
column36: which bundles its security solutions with its   networking hardware and software. It also helps FireEye keep pace   with perimeter security rivals like Palo Alto
column37: which launched a   comparable bundle dubbed the Next-Generation Security Platform   earlier this  year. FireEye still faces intense competition   from companies like Cisco and Palo Alto
column38: but at least Helix helps   it lock in more customers and widen its moat.The key takeawayFireEye still has a lot to prove before I'd consider buying it   as a contrarian play. Analysts expect its revenue to rise just   16% this year and 10% next year -- which compares poorly to its    46% growth last year. However
column39: I'll still be keeping an eye   on Mandia's next moves as well as FireEye's growth in cloud and   platform services -- which could help the stock rebound next   year.10 stocks we like better than FireEyeWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column40: it can pay to listen. After all
column41: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column42: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column43: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and FireEye wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of Nov. 7

column1: 3 Stocks to Watch on Wednesday: Ford Motor Company (F)
column2: Galena Biopharma Inc (GALE) and Anthera Pharmaceuticals Inc (ANTH);12/28/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsU.S. stocks are nearing the end of calendar 2016 at (or trying   to push through to) all-time highs. TheS&P 500 Indeximproved 0.2% on Tuesday
column4: theDow Jones Industrial Averagefinished 0.1% higher and theNasdaq Compositesurged 0.5% to hit a new record high. Still
column5: Dow 20K remains   elusive.As we head into what's sure to be a light-volume Wednesday
column6: a few   stocks are still worth a look. Today
column7: we're focusing onGalena Biopharma Inc(NASDAQ:GALE)
column8: Anthera Pharmaceuticals Inc(NASDAQ:ANTH) andFord Motor Company(NYSE:F).makeArticleAd();Here's what you should know:Galena Biopharma Inc (GALE)GALE shares were booming in Wednesday's premarket trade   on news that the company's drug GALE-401 - which treats the rare   blood disorder
column9: thrombocythemia - will be moving into   late-stage trials.GALE-401 is a controlled release formulation of anagrelide
column10: which reduces elevated platelet count and ameliorates associated   symptoms
column11: including thrombo-hemorrhagic events. High platelet   counts can cause strokes and heart attacks.Galena's treatment is designed to slowly release the drug   throughout the body
column12: cutting down on instances of side effects   that result from maximum or peak plasma concentrations following   administration.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017Prior to the news
column13: GALE shares were off more than 90%
column14: fueled   by the discontinuation of a clinical trial for NeuVax. However
column15: the positive headline for GALE-401 has the stock up 25% in   response.Anthera Pharmaceuticals Inc (ANTH)ANTH shares were on the other edge of the clinical trial   sword
column16: tanking afterdisappointing results.Anthera's Sollpura is a medication that helps to treat   cystic fibrosis
column17: specifically helping maldigestion in patients.   However
column18: the drug ""narrowly"" missed its primary endpoint
column19: sending   shares to the ground.One point of potential hope: The company said the study's   structure may have contributed to the failure. ANTH now says it   intends to perform a new experiment in Q1 2017.ANTH shares were off more than 60% in early Wednesday   trade.Ford Motor Company (F)Fordis facing a probeby U.S. regulators regarding some of its vehicles' brakes.The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration announced   on Tuesday that it was launching an investigation to determine   whether or not the company's Ford Fusion and Mercury Milan sedans   from model year 2007 through 2009 have defective breaks.At least three crashes have taken place due to the   malfunction
column20: according to the agency. No injuries have been   reported so far surrounding these crashes.If these Ford cars' brakes are found to have such a flaw
column21: a   recall could follow in the near future. Rough or uneven surfaces   may also be to blame as the turbulence may cause the anti-lock   braking system to disarm. Such a landing could delay the effect   of the brakes stopping the vehicles
column22: increasing the distance it   takes for the sedans to stop.Another recent Ford recall involves 2010 and 2011 Fusion   and Milan models due to fuel tanks that may crack.F shares were unchanged in premarket trading.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Risk

column3: Boost Top Line;12/27/2016;"Shares ofCisco Systems
column4: Inc.CSCOhave performed more or less in line with the broaderZacks Computer Networkingindustry on a year-to-date basis. While the industry generated a positive return of 11.6%
column5: the stock returned 12.4%.The not-so-impressive performance of the stock could be due to intensifying competition from several smaller players
column6: slowing order growth from service providers and challenges in the emerging markets.Meanwhile
column7: per a Reuters report

column1: 6 Tech Companies Investing Billions in Their Future;12/26/2016;"Staying relevant through constant innovation and disruption is   more important in the tech industry than in arguably any other   sector. By investing heavily in research and development   (R&D)
column2: these companies are making expensive bets on the   future and what technology and trends will lead it -- along with   their own sales and profits.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();6 companies investing billions in R&DTo compile this list
column3: we looked at the total dollar amount   that publicly traded tech companies have each spent on R&D   over the past year. There are many companies investing heavily in   R&D
column4: both by real dollar amount and also relative to their   own market cap.
column5: but here are the six companies that stood out as   shaping the future based on how much they have invested
column6: and will   probably continue to do so
column7: to be the ones at the forefront of   future development.CompanyMarket CapR&D Spend (Previous 12 Months)Alphabet Inc.$531 billion$13.8 billionIntel Corporation$176 billion$13 billionMicrosoft Corporation$468 billion$12.1 billionApple Inc.$582 billion$10 billionOracle Corporation$159 billion$6.5 billionCisco Systems
column8: Inc.$148 billion$6.3 billionData source: Capital IQWhat those billions are going afterIt's not surprising thatAlphabet(NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)  tops the list as the biggest   investor in the in the world in terms of R&D spend.   Alphabet's willingness to spend heavily on research into areas   such as self-driving cars
column9: artificial intelligence
column10: and wearable   technology such as Google Glass and connected clothing shows how   the company is working to assure it has a place in the world far   beyond the internet search that currently makes up the vast   majority of its revenue. Alphabet's recent restructuring to make   Google one segment of the overall company was specifically   designed to allow the company to continue making audacious   moonshot bets.Alphabet's self-driving car project
column11: now called Waymo. Image   source: Alphabet/Waymo.Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) recently announced that it will release a device   to compete in the smart-home space. Powered by its Cortana   voice-enabled artificial intelligence platform
column12: this device will   compete directly with similar products such as Google Home. Other   big investments in the past few years from Microsoft include   cloud computing and more work on its Windows operating system for   mobile devices and as an ""Internet of Things"" platform. It's yet   to be seen how Microsoft's recent acquisition of LinkedIn will   fully play out
column13: but you can expect that it links up with some of   the areas Microsoft has been investing heavily in already.Intel
column14: Oracle
column15: andCisco Systemsare each working hard to keep their industry-dominating positions   from younger and more fast-paced companies within the   microprocessor
column16: graphic chip
column17: and computing network space. These   three behemoth companies have been building and developing   infrastructure for cloud computing
column18: internet security
column19: and other   digital-age network services that require new technology far   beyond what their own technology could handle in years past.   Building and preparing for these big growth trends in such a   fast-moving segment of the IT industry will like drive higher   R&D spending in these companies for years to come.Finally
column20: there'sApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) . This company has been the focus of much analysis   in the past few years for not releasing enough new and   astonishing tech
column21: so much so that many of those analysts have   questioned if Apple's growth days are behind it. However
column22: the   company is one of the biggest investors in R&D
column23: seemingly   going after the connected-car market
column24: artificial intelligence
column25: or   other long-term investments such as building much more   comprehensive software platforms. What makes Apple especially   interesting is that it's by far the wealthiest company on the   list by total cash value
column26: which was a record of nearly $238   billion in cash
column27: cash equivalents
column28: and marketable securities   in its most recent quarter. That's more than double the cash of   second-place Microsoft
column29: with $117 billion.Preparing for bigger spending to comeIf those numbers don't already look massive enough
column30: they could   get bigger in the coming years. Apple's $238 billion in cash? The   vast majority of that amount is stored offshore
column31: where Apple is   holding it because the company doesn't want to pay the around 35%   corporate tax to repatriate it back to the United States.As part of a tax system overhaul
column32: President-elect Donald   Trump has said he seeks to lower this corporate tax rate and   could even provide a special 10% tax for companies that are   seeking to repatriate a huge chunk of cash back to the States.The richest companies in the U.S.
column33: then

column35: would probably then repatriate much of that cash and could put   the money to work in increased R&D spending.Like much of the potential changes coming to corporate tax or   other policy

column37: what the   final numbers will be
column38: how much each of that overseas cash each   company would bring back

column1: Cisco Systems
column2: Inc. (CSCO) Stock’s Financials Are Good
column3: But Technicals Are Better;12/23/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAfter getting burned throughout most of last decade
column5: Cisco Systems
column6: Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) is taking acautious approachto their guidance for the new year. In the second quarter of fiscal year 2017
column7: Cisco anticipates a drop in sales due to headwinds generated by a global competitive environment. CEO Chuck Robbins referenced uncertainties in the world economy
column8: as well as potential regulations under the incoming Donald Trump administration.Source:Prayitno via Flickr (Modified)Although you can't go wrong erring on the side of caution
column9: Cisco might be hedging their bets unnecessarily. There are a number of technology sectors in which the networking giant can leverage its power
column10: key among them being theInternet of Things. This is a market that's projected to hit $1.7 trillion by the year 2020.makeArticleAd();Furthermore
column11: the company has a division called ""IoT Systems and Software."" You can't get any more direct than that for CSCO stock!Understandably
column12: with a lucrative market comes intense competition. The IoT business is unique in that it brings out aneclectic bunch.NVIDIA Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA)
column13: Amazon.com
column14: Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN)
column15: andGeneral Electric Company(NYSE:GE) are all competing in one form or another. Of course
column16: you can't ignore industry titans likeAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column17: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT).Although that seems like a tough matchup for CSCO stock
column18: I wouldn't short-change it.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017Arguably
column19: Cisco is in the best position to advantage IoT
column20: as it has the brains and the architecture. By default
column21: the company can provide the physical connectivity through itsvast networks. Also
column22: Cisco can offer security mechanisms and standardization measures for IoT device makers.Strong technical tailwinds for CSCO stockAll of these are wonderful reasons to consider buying up CSCO stock. However
column23: what I like best is its technical momentum. Frankly
column24: a fundamental story is only that - a story. The difference is whether or not investors are willing to risk money on it.Most indicators suggest that Cisco stock is poised for greater things in the coming years.Let's start with the low-hanging fruit. Year-to-date
column25: Cisco shares are up over 12%. Based on recent trends
column26: the actual return shouldn't be too far off from that figure. Yes
column27: the price action has been a little choppy since the beginning of September. Nevertheless
column28: CSCO stock is trading above its 50- and 200-day moving averages.I'm also encouraged by the substantive gains made in the wake of the ""Great Recession."" From 2008 until the end of 2011
column29: CSCO stock returned a lousy -7%. But from 2012 onwards
column30: it has been a different company altogether
column31: with Cisco averaging 14% in the black. If it weren't for a volatile 2015
column32: the average would be much higher.Even then
column33: you have to love how CSCO stock just brushed the negativity aside.Cisco Stock Broke Past a Key Resistance LevelClick to EnlargeMoving forward
column34: the prospects for Cisco are bright for investors.I say this because the company busted open a long-term resistance level. In 2007
column35: the average high on an adjusted basis was a little over $28. This is approximately the same price point where Cisco stock faltered last year. As previously mentioned
column36: it picked itself up in impressive fashion. More importantly
column37: shares are convincingly above the bearish ceiling.If CSCO stock had failed
column38: we would be looking at a double-top formation. Bearish traders would have noted that the bulls attempted to push Cisco above a psychological threshold without success. That could have led to a self-fulfilling prophesy
column39: engendering further panic.Fortunately
column40: that's not how things turned out. I would argue that with the breakthrough
column41: CSCO stock has a clean slate. Combined with its enormous strength and financial stability
column42: this is a company on the rise. Unless there was an absolutely compelling reason to bet against Cisco stock
column43: investors are much safer going long.Under Armour Inc (UA) Stock or Nike Inc (NKE):     Which to Own in 2017?Of course
column44: tech is hardly a consistent and reliable sector. Innovation occurs in a heartbeat. Getting things wrong ever so slightly can trigger heavy consequences years down the road. But despite these pitfalls
column45: CSCO stock has proven its worth. The IoT business should be an exciting era for Cisco and its better positioned than most of its competitors.But the most important consideration is that people are buying the story. That goes so much further than any other analysis.As of this writing
column46: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace5 Blue-Chip Stock Charts to Watch in 201710 High-Risk

column1: Bull of the Day: Broadcom (AVGO);12/22/2016;"Broadcom(AVGO) is a textbook example of how the Zacks Rank can keep you invested in a growth stock quarter after quarter to ride meaningful long-term gains
column2: or simply to trade the swings along the way. And another ""beat and raise"" quarter has AVGO back to the top of investor buy lists.makeZacksArticleAd();Since I first discovered this blue-chip technology ""arms dealer"" back in 2014 when it was trading $70
column3: and still named Avago Technologies
column4: it has quadrupled revenues to over $13 billion primarily through key acquisitions like LSI Logic and Broadcom
column5: its new namesake.Today we'll look at why AVGO (they kept the original Avago stock symbol) remains a favorite among institutional investors
column6: which is really the same reason it consistently earns the highest Zacks rank every quarter: earnings momentum.3 Key SegmentsThough Broadcom is generally classified as a semiconductor designer and developer
column7: its solutions serve telecom and enterprise networking customers in the build-out of data centers and high-speed
column8: broadband communications. I can't say for sure if AT&T (T)
column9: Cisco (CSCO)
column10: or Alphabet (GOOGL) are customers
column11: but I would be surprised if they weren't.Thus about half of Broadcom's sales come from the Wired Infrastructure segment which has been seeing steady double-digit growth as these big customers transition to the 100 Gigabit Ethernet protocol. More on this ""need for speed"" in a moment.Approximately 30% of Broadcom's revenues come from its Wireless Communications division which serves top-end mobile smart-device makers likeApple(AAPL) with radio frequency (RF) chips
column12: amplifiers
column13: and FBAR technology filters. Broadcom FBAR (Film Bulk Acoustic Resonator) filters are a form of bulk acoustic wave (BAW) filter that have superior performance with steeper rejection curves compared to surface acoustic wave (SAW) filters.The third major segment at Broadcom is Enterprise Storage
column14: which connects back with many customers from the Wired division and supplies just under 20% of revenues. The company's products enable the high-speed movement of digital data with a secure connection among multiple PCs
column15: servers and storage devices such as hard disk drives and solid state drives.While AVGO's Wireless business is ""dependent"" on Apple
column16: that's not exactly a bad problem to have. The coming next wave of 5G technology will keep both companies rolling in sales growth.And Broadcom's largest business
column17: the Wired segment
column18: is very busy meeting the demand of companies building high-speed
column19: broadband networks
column20: especially with the data-hogging loads of video and the storage requirements of the Internet of Things.Here was part of a recent press release which explains well the infrastructure technology that makes them what I call the blue chip ""arms dealer"" for the 100G connected world...SAN JOSE
column21: Calif. and SINGAPORE
column22: Dec. 15
column23: 2016 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Broadcom Limited (NASDAQ:AVGO)
column24: a leading designer
column25: developer and global supplier of a broad range of digital and analog semiconductor connectivity solutions
column26: today announced shipments of its latest series of heterogeneous knowledge-based processors (KBPs)
column27: the BCM15000 (BCM15K)
column28: designed for modern network infrastructure including core
column29: edge and data center routers and switches. The BCM15K is a new series of 16nm KBPs which integrates TCAM
column30: SRAM and algorithmic search technology to enable unprecedented levels of forwarding
column31: classification and security for service provider routers and switches. Compared with previous generation KBP products
column32: the BCM15K delivers internet search speeds up to 7.2 billion searches per second (BSPS) and aggregate data transfer rates up to 1 terabit per second (Tbps)
column33: which are 8x and 3x improvements
column34: respectively.As global internet traffic will soon surpass a zettabyte on an annual basis and bandwidth-intensive applications such as cloud computing and video streaming continue to expand
column35: next-generation networks would need more advanced routers and switches that are capable of handling terabit bandwidth and performing multi-billion packet search operations per second. Efficiently supporting these applications at these speeds means next-generation routers and switches would need a specialized
column36: high performing KBP that has advanced Layer 2 to Layer 4 packet header processing capabilities enabling service providers to deliver services with QoS and security guarantees.(end of Broadcom PR)After AVGO's recent ""beat and raise"" report
column37: the analysts chimed in with a handful all choosing to bump their price target to $210
column38: while Sanford Bernstein and Oppenheimer opted for $215.B. Riley not to be outdone by anyone
column39: raised their PT from $225 to $235.Oppenheimer analysts titled their post-earning report ""Christmas Came Early"" and summarized their views thus on December 9...We are raising our estimates and PT on AVGO following management's latest beat/ raise. column1: Why Cisco Systems Could Have a Great 2017;12/20/2016;"Networking hardware giantCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) has been cautious when talking about its outlook   for the new year. The company is anticipating a revenue decline   during its fiscal second quarter
column2: driven by what the company   calls ""a challenging global business environment."" CEO Chuck   Robbins pointed to macroeconomic uncertainty as well as   uncertainty surrounding the political and regulatory environments   following the election as the main reasons for the weak guidance.   The company is taking a conservative approach and not modeling   any improvement in these areas going forward.Cisco's guidance may be too pessimistic. Analysts from Cowen   & Co. recently surveyed 118 IT executives in the U.S. to   gather clues about how the IT spending environment would evolve   next year. While there was some uncertainty among those surveyed   due to the results of the election
column3: Cowen found that the majority   expect IT budgets to grow next year. Networking infrastructure   was viewed by the executives as a high priority

column8: while 59% expect a 6%   increase. Cowen pointed out that these numbers aren't quite as   strong as in its May 2016 survey

column14: responses to our 4Q16 IT Survey indicate a relatively favorable   outlook for the Networking industry in general and for CSCO in   particular.""What to watch in 2017Cisco's switching and routing businesses -- the core of the   company that accounted for 45% of revenue during fiscal 2016 --   have been volatile in recent quarters. Switching revenue was flat   in fiscal 2016

column17: but the   survey results suggest that both businesses could produce some   growth in 2017. This comes at a good time - two of Cisco's   smaller growth businesses

column14: but there's still reliance on some basic networking technology

column16: which found that Arista infringed on two out of an alleged six Cisco patents. But there will be a review (to be completed in Apr 2017) and Arista is already developing a workaround for one. The other patent will expire in 2018. The ITC
column17: which can only ban import of infringing products is therefore unlikely to have a huge impact on Arista. Read more:Cisco Wins Patent Infringement Lawsuit Against AristaLater in the week
column18: a federal jury decided that while Arista infringed on other Cisco patents related to command line interface (CLI) technology
column19: it didn't owe Cisco any damages. The case was decided on the doctrine of ""scènes à faire
column20: which can be invoked in cases where certain creative works were the result of circumstances rather than creative pursuit
column21: for example
column22: where software needs to be compatible with technical standards or certain hardware.Cisco asked for $335 million in damages for Arista's infringing of over 500 CLI commands. Cisco will appeal the decision and a representative told the press
column23: ""We respectfully disagree with the verdict."" Read more:Cisco Receives Adverse Ruling Against Arista in CaliforniaYahoo HackedYahoo has now announced the second major data breach
column24: this one being the largest to date involving names

column27: dates of birth

column29: in some cases
column30: encrypted or unencrypted security questions and answers related to a billion customers. Moreover

column34: when data related to 500 million accounts was compromised.People familiar to discussions at Verizon are now saying that the company is looking to renegotiate the purchase price
column35: last fixed at around $4.8 billion. Verizon does have that option: citing the ""material adverse effect"" clause
column36: which has reportedly been used for just this purpose in Delaware
column37: where Yahoo is domiciled. It hasn't ever been used to terminate merger agreements. This can extend the date of closure as the companies determine the total financial impact of the data breaches.So far

column1: Cisco Systems
column2: Inc. (CSCO) Stock Will Have a Breakout Year in 2017;12/20/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsCisco Systems
column4: Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) was hit with a recent setback that's reminiscent of its choppy   ride in the second half of the year. On Wednesday
column5: federal court   jurors in San Jose
column6: California handed a victory to fierce CSCO   rivalArista Networks Inc(NYSE:ANET). According to a Reuters report
column7: CSCO was seeking $335 million   in damages due to ""copyright infringementof its user interfaces.""However
column8: jurors were not convinced that Cisco's unique user   interface technologies were developed solely as a result   of the company's creativity.Instead
column9: Arista's attorneys successfully defended against CSCO by   deploying the ""scenes a faire"" argument.makeArticleAd();This states that
column10: in certain circumstances
column11: an idea cannot be   expressed unless it incorporates specific elements. These   elements then no longer have the traditional copyright protection   of exclusivity. Not surprisingly
column12: Cisco stock absorbed a small   loss of value following the verdict.More so than the actual impact of the lawsuit is its   implications. As noted by InvestorPlace writer Tom Taulli
column13: thebiggest challenge facing Cisco stock is   competition. In the company's primary networking business
column14: the   company faces industry giants such asJuniper Networks
column15: Inc. (NYSE:JNPR) andHewlett Packard Enterprise Co(NYSE:HPE). Worse yet
column16: the pool of potential CSCO customers   is shrinking asAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column17: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) are developing their own networking solutions.As to be expected
column18: the big boys have taken their toll   fundamentally on Cisco stock. The technology company took a   sizable blow in its hardware and router business for the most   recent quarter. Switching to other sectors hasn't always resulted   in consistent success
column19: either. Even there
column20: industries such as   network security are dominated by firms likePalo Alto Networks Inc(NYSE:PANW) andFortinet Inc(NASDAQ:FTNT). No matter which way it goes
column21: CSCO stock will face a tough   road.10 High-Risk
column22: High-Reward Stocks to Buy for       2017Cisco Stock Has the Right StuffThat said
column23: no company is guaranteed an easy path. Even if a   business is flourishing today
column24: competition is only right around   the corner. Since digital networking isn't exactly a proprietary   function
column25: the next best thing for an investor is to find a   financially sturdy player. There's going to be a lot of tumbles
column26: as the recent verdict demonstrates
column27: but Cisco stock is one of   those names that's built like a linebacker.This simply means that CSCO stock can take it just as much as   it can dish it. There's a lot to like in thebalance sheet- rising cash levels
column28: controlled inventory
column29: and investments in   physical infrastructure. That tells me that management is serious   about strategy and vision
column30: providing confidence for long-term   holders of Cisco stock. Also
column31: CSCO has excellent free cash   flow
column32: so the administration aspect of the business is about as   close to worry-free as you can get.I'm especially impressed by Cisco's financial discipline.   Profitability margins continue to lead the industry
column33: and are well   in line with historical averages. Too many times in the broader   tech sector we see organizations that are doing relatively well   today
column34: but poorly against prior results. This is not so with   Cisco stock. Because of this discipline
column35: shares are also   undervalued against trailing earnings.Should You Buy CSCO Stock?Based on the fundamentals
column36: CSCO stock looks like an incredible   buy. While the networking icon is having a great 2016 - shares   are up 13% year to date - Wall Street consensus isn't quite so   enthusiastic. Yes
column37: the majority ofcovering analysts are bullishon Cisco stock
column38: but
column39: there's a sizable number with ""hold""   ratings. For the fence-sitters
column40: they view the $30 level as   technical resistance. Indeed
column41: shares only got into trouble this   year after it breached this level.Understandably
column42: that's no confidence boost.However
column43: let's consider a few facts. The average price of Cisco   stock in 1999 - just before it went ballistic in the 2000 tech   bubble - was $27.77.From 2001-2007
column44: the average price dropped to $17.49. This   year
column45: CSCO stock has largely traded above $28. So
column46: bear in mind   that when the issue of ""technical resistance"" comes up it's an   arbitrary comparison. The bigger picture shows that the Cisco   stock rally is serious business.I'm also loving the fact that in the current decade we have   seen three double-digit annual returns for CSCO stock
column47: inclusive   of this year. That achievement matches what we saw in the entire   2000's decade. But
column48: the context is even more important.10 ""Best of the Best"" Stocks to Buy for       2017In the past decade
column49: those monster returns succeeded monster   losses. This time around
column50: none of the double-digit performances   followed negative returns. In other words
column51: this is a sustainable   rally
column52: not a reactionary one.Now we have to set expectations straight - I doubt that Cisco   stock is going to make you rich overnight. It's an industry giant   in a competitive and saturated environment. But
column53: this is exactly   what makes CSCO stock compelling. No one's going to play nice in   tech. If you're gonna be in a gunfight
column54: it's best to have some   armor.As of this writing
column55: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in     any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Risk
column56: High-Reward Stocks to Buy for       201710 Losers That Will Be 2017's Best Stocks to       BuyThe postCisco Systems
column57: Inc. (CSCO) Stock Will Have a   Breakout Year in 2017appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: The 3 Best Dividend Stocks for Beginning Investors in 2017;12/20/2016;"Image source: Getty Images.The stock market can sometimes feel a bit overwhelming for   beginning investors. There are more than 7
column2: 000 different equities   to choose from across a variety of sectors
column3: and each has its own   unique set of risks and catalysts.However
column4: one of the very few constants that's held up over the   long run
column5: and which beginning investors can take comfort in
column6: is   thatdividend   stockstend to outperform non-dividend-paying stocks. Think about it   this way: the only companies that are usually going to share a   percentage of their profits with shareholders are those with   sound business models that have withstood the test of time
column7: as   well as companies that expect to grow
column8: or at least retain their   competitive advantage. In a way
column9: dividend stocks are beacons of   success for beginning investors to follow.makeArticleAd();Of course
column10: that isn't all. Dividends can help to hedge the   impact of the stock market's inevitable corrections
column11: and they can   also be reinvested back into shares of more dividend-paying stock   via Dividend Reinvestment Plans
column12: or DRIPs. This repeating pattern   of buying more stock with your dividend payout and thusly   receiving a larger dividend during the next payout is a trick the   smartest investors on Wall Street use to get rich.So where's a new investor to begin? My suggestion would be to   consider the following threebest dividend   stocksin 2017.Image source: Getty Images.Johnson & JohnsonIt's certainly not going to wow investors with double-digit   growth anymore
column13: but healthcare conglomerateJohnson & Johnson(NYSE: JNJ) has everything you'd look for in a top dividend stock   for a beginning investor.The most attractive component of Johnson & Johnson is its   business diversity. It's composed of more than 250 subsidiaries
column14: making divestments and acquisitions easier to incorporate without   disrupting the larger business
column15: and it has three primary revenue   channels
column16: each with its own purpose:Consumer health products is a slower-growth segment
column17: but     J&J's brand-name health products are usually inelastic and     maintain strong pricing power. Thus
column18: J&J's health products     segment tends to generate consistent and predictable cash     flow.Medical devices have grown slower of late
column19: likely a result     of increasing competition in the device space. However
column20: an     aging America that's living longer than ever is bound to need     an increasing amount of preventative care via hip
column21: knee
column22: and     spine procedures in the years to come
column23: setting up J&J for     success.Pharmaceuticals are the icing on the cake for J&J as     its branded drugs provide most of its operating margin. Between     2009 and mid-2014
column24: Johnson & Johnson brought 14 novel     medicines to market
column25: half of which have gone on to generate $1     billion-plus in annual sales. Management believes another 10     blockbuster drugs can be brought to market (or at least have     new drug applications filed with the Food and Drug     Administration) by 2019.Johnson & Johnson is currently sitting on nearly $41   billion in cash and cash equivalents
column26: boasts one of just two AAA   credit ratings from Standard & Poor's for all publicly traded   companies (the highest credit rating given by S&P)
column27: and has a   54-year streak of increasing its payout
column28: putting it among truly   elite company. J&J's 2.8% yield is nicely above the average   yield for theS&P 500
column29: making it one of the best dividend stocks
column30: and least volatile   investments
column31: for beginning investors.Image source: Pixabay.NextEra EnergyAnother great dividend stock for beginning investors to   consider isNextEra Energy(NYSE: NEE) in the utility sector.Electric utility stocks are often a great place to start for   both income-seeking investors and beginning investors because   they deal with an inelastic product: electricity. If you own a   home
column32: rent an apartment
column33: or run a business
column34: you need electricity.   With the exception of being unable to control Mother Nature
column35: electricity usage and regulatory price increases make cash flow   and profitability somewhat predictable -- and trust me
column36: Wall   Street and investors love when there aren't any surprises.However
column37: NextEra Energy doesn't have too much in common with   your standard utility company. Whereas most electric utilities   have only begun to recognize the benefits of alternative   energies
column38: NextEra has been embracing them for more than a decade.   NextEra Energy and its affiliates are the largest provider of   renewable energy from the wind and sun in the world. Not to   mention it also is one of the largest operators of commercial   nuclear power with the capacity to generate more than 6.4 GW of   emissions-free electricity
column39: which is enough to power almost 5   million households.NextEra Energy's focus on going green is critical for a number   of reasons. To begin with
column40: though the expense of focusing on   renewable energy is costly upfront
column41: NextEra's   electricity-generating costs are probably going to be a lot lower   five or 10 years from now than nearly all of its peers which   could be scrambling to install wind and solar platforms.   Secondly
column42: it puts NextEra ahead of the curve when it comes to   reducing its carbon emissions. Should the U.S. Environmental   Protection Agency choose to tighten emissions regulations in the   years or decades to come
column43: NextEra will be prepared. Lastly
column44: its   high usage of wind and solar means lower long-term costs for the   consumer
column45: which probably means a happier customer.NextEra likely has the potential to grow its profits by   between 5% and 9% annually through the end of the decade
column46: which
column47: when combined with its 2.9% dividend yield
column48: could make it one of   the best dividend stocks for beginning investors to own.Image source: Getty Images.Cisco SystemsOne of the best dividend stocks beginning investors can   consider buying from the technology sector is networking giantCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) .Like all stocks
column49: Cisco Systems has its imperfections.   Innovation within the technology space moves rapidly
column50: and from   time to time Cisco has had to ramp up its spending to seemingly   catch up with the next innovative wave. We're beginning to see   Cisco's investments really pay off. For instance
column51: in August Cisco   announced that it was going to eliminate 5
column52: 500 jobs in its   traditional switching and router division
column53: which it primarily   supplies to enterprise customers and telecom carriers
column54: and it   invest the ""savings"" into faster-growing software segments
column55: such   as security
column56: cloud-computing
column57: and the Internet of Things
column58: all of   which have long-term double-digit growth potential. During the   first quarter of fiscal 2017
column59: security revenue wound up   increasing 11% year over year.However
column60: investors don't have to throw Cisco's legacy   businesses out with the bathwater just yet. Even though it's   making the move into software
column61: it's still a dominant player in   networking equipment (switching and routing)
column62: which is nothing to   sneeze at. Asnoted by my Foolish colleague Tim Green
column63: Cisco had north of 60% market share in the switching market
column64: according to IDC
column65: in 2015. Comparatively
column66: there aren't any other   manufacturers above 9% market share
column67: leaving Cisco as the   brand-name hardware company in the networking space. And it's   still healthfully profitable on these products.But if there's one thing Cisco's dominance brings to the table   every year
column68: it's lots of free cash flow. Earlier this year Cisco   announced a $15 billion share buyback and once again increased   its dividend (by 24% this go-around). Currently yielding 3.4%
column69: Cisco is in prime position to benefit income-seeking investors   and those beginning investors who are terrified of risk and want   to own brand-name companies.10 stocks we like better than Cisco SystemsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column70: it can pay to listen. After all
column71: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade

column1: Should You Buy Cisco Systems Inc. (CSCO) in 2017?;12/19/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsFor a boring company
column3: Cisco Systems Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO) generates a lot of heat among analysts.Over half its analysts currently rate the stocka buy
column4: but JPMorgan says CSCO is ina ""tough spot
column5: amid below-average growth and rising interest rates.makeArticleAd();Which side is right? Well
column6: both
column7: actually.Like some other tech companies
column8: such asInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM)
column9: Cisco has been executing a turn this decade from being a   growth stock to a yield play. It initiated a dividend in 2011 at   six cents per share
column10: but that's now up to 26 cents
column11: yielding   3.4%.CSCO shares
column12: while up 71% over the past five years
column13: trail   the 85% gain in the S&P 500 during that period. Buying Cisco   for growth
column14: in short
column15: has become a bad play
column16: but those who bought   it for yield have done well.7 Big Tech Stocks to Buy for Dow 20
column17: 000The Open ThreatLikeOracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL)
column18: which has been disappointing the Street in recent earnings   announcements
column19: Cisco faces a threat from open source. In its   case
column20: the threat comes in the form of the Open Compute Project   (OCP)
column21: originally launched byFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) to reduce the cost of building cloud data centers. Hardware is   becoming software
column22: and even specialized pieces of hardware
column23: like   switches
column24: are becoming virtual.Whenever CEO Chuck Robbins addresses the media or analysts
column25: he   is asked about the OCP
column26: and his answer is always the same. It's a   threat on the low end
column27: not on the high end;it's not an either-or but both.While that answer is accurate
column28: it underestimates the long-term   threat. Virtualization is making all sorts of hardware into   software. Custom chips and proprietary software may be necessary   in some markets
column29: but the industry's mega-trend is keeping switch   margins down
column30: even while formal competition is reduced
column31: and that   is not changing.Cisco is slowly losing its niche.Seeking New MarketsAware of the threat
column32: Cisco is seekingleadership in new markets.Since 2012
column33: Cisco has made dozens ofacquisitions in computer securityto develop its ""Security Everywhere"" strategy. Most
column34: likeCloudLock
column35: bought in June

column1: What Is The Cloud And How Are Companies Making Money With It?;12/19/2016;"In recent years
column2: the “cloud” has emerged as one of the major focus area for technology giants such as Microsoft
column3: Amazon
column4: Google and IBM among other players.“By 2020
column5: a corporate ""no-cloud"" policy will be as rare as a ""no-internet"" policy is today
column6: ”accordingto Gartner.Cloud can simply be thought of as the Internet. With cloud
column7: instead of maintaining on-premises data centers with computer hardware and software
column8: companies can access all systems on the cloud platform of the service provider.makeArticleAd();“Cloud computing is a model for enabling ubiquitous
column9: convenient
column10: on-demand network access to a shared pool of configurable computing resources (e.g.
column11: networks
column12: servers
column13: storage
column14: applications
column15: and services) that can be rapidly provisioned and released with minimal management effort or service provider interaction” asexplainedby the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)
column16: Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) are the three offerings which can either be on a public
column17: private or hybrid cloud.While cloud computing services have been offered for more than a decade
column18: companies were initially skeptical about such offerings amid concerns of sharing sensitive records and security of company’s data.However
column19: with its advantages such as flexibility
column20: cutting of capital expenditure
column21: easy anytime-anywhere access
column22: disaster recovery
column23: no fear of lost devices and opportunity for smaller enterprises to use infrastructure which cannot be afforded in-house
column24: all started to attract enterprises to the cloud.It isestimatedthat
column25: “The savings created by a flexible infrastructure can be substantial
column26: between 25% and 50% in federal agencies studied by the Brookings Institute.”Gartnerestimatesthat
column27: “the IT spending is steadily shifting from traditional IT offerings to cloud services (cloud shift). The aggregate amount of cloud shift in 2016 is estimated to reach $111 billion
column28: increasing to $216 billion in 2020.” It is further estimated that “more than $1 trillion in IT spending will be directly or indirectly affected by the shift to cloud during the next five years.”Companies And The CloudAmazon(AMZN)'s Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the undisputed market leader in cloud computing. Itdominatedthe worldwide public IaaS with a 45% market share while it held about 35% of public PaaS during Q3 FY 2016. It generated $3.2 billion in revenue for AWS during Q3 FY 2016.Microsoft(MSFT) has been highly focused on the cloud since Satya Nadella took over the reins at Microsoft. The company plans to realize $20 billion as commercial cloud annualized revenue run rate by 2018; the same was reported at $12.1 billion during FY 2016.Cloud is an important component ofIBM's(IBM) “strategic imperatives.” DuringQ3 2016
column29: IBM’s cloud revenue (public
column30: private and hybrid) increased 44% to $3.4 billion while its cloud revenue over the trailing 12 months was $12.7 billion.Google(GOOG

column32: Urs Hölzle

column34: “My goal is for us to talk about Google as a cloud company in 2020 because our revenue is bigger than the ads revenue and it’s a realistic possibility.”Salesforce(CRM) is featured among themost innovative companiesin the world and earns majority of its revenue from cloud computing. column37: “We are uniquely positioned as a cloud provider to deliver both top line and bottom line growth.” Adobe marketing cloud achieved $1.63 billion in annual revenue
column38: 20% year-on-year growth.Oracle(ORCL) offers cloud services across all three service models i.e. SaaS
column39: PaaS and IaaS. As per its earningsreport
column40: “Oracle is the number one player in SaaS cloud applications sales to customers with over 1
column41: 000 employees.” During Q2 FY 2017

column44: Rackspace

column48: workday

column56: CEO

column67: and enhanced security system on the cloud."

column1: Broadcom Ships World's First 16 nm Knowledge-Based Chips;12/19/2016;"Shares ofBroadcom LimitedAVGOhave underperformed the broader Zacks Electronics- Semiconductors industry on a year-to-date basis. While the industry generated a return of 49.7%
