column1: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: Apple
column2: Cisco
column3: Intel
column4: NVIDIA and Facebook;11/23/2016;"For Immediate ReleaseChicago
column5: IL - November 23
column6: 2016 - Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog includeApple(Nasdaq:AAPL-Free Report)
column7: Cisco(Nasdaq:CSCO-Free Report)
column8: Intel(Nasdaq:INTC-Free Report)
column9: NVIDIA(Nasdaq:NVDA-Free Report) andFacebook(Nasdaq:FB-Free Report).Today
column10: Zacks is promoting its ''Buy'' stock recommendations.Get #1Stock of the Day pick for free.Here are highlights from Tuesday's Analyst Blog:Tech Stock Roundup: iPhones
column11: A.I.
column12: Self-Driving Cars and     MoreLast week was an exciting one with some rumors about Apple's (Nasdaq:AAPL-Free Report) iPhone manufacturing in the U.S.
column13: Cisco's (Nasdaq:CSCO-Free Report) earnings report
column14: Intel's (Nasdaq:INTC-Free Report) first AI Day plus lots more.iPhone Manufacturing In The U.S.In June this year
column15: Apple requested its iPhone assemblers Pegatron and Foxconn to evaluate the feasibility of making the devices in the U.S. While Pegatron refused outright on cost considerations
column16: Foxconn has decided to do the job. The study is likely to show that the cost increase
column17: skill mismatch and supply chain problems (the supply chain is largely in Asia) would make this cost prohibitive.This would raise iPhone prices for consumers/squeeze Apple's margins. But the study will help Apple negotiate with the government
column18: which might agree to fund skill development and/or subsidize U.S.-made phones. If not
column19: Apple could introduce a luxury line of iPhones manufactured in the U.S. and try to set off the super normal profits on those with the increased cost of phones carrying the government import duty.Note that Apple is not the only smartphone maker saddled with the problem. So if all smartphones get more expensive
column20: Apple's market share may not be affected.Cisco Earnings ReportCisco's first quarter 2017 resultstopped the Zacks Consensus Estimateon both the top and bottom lines but the guidance disappointed. Switching remains a sore point for Cisco in a market increasingly favoring SDN networks and leveraging the cloud. So it's not surprising that this segment declined 7%. The company had greater success in security where both advanced threat (up 100%) and web security (up 60%) were strong.Intel A.I. DayAt its first Artificial Intelligence (AI) Day in San Francisco last week
column21: Intel announced bold plans to target the deep learning segment that is currently dominated by NVIDIA (Nasdaq:NVDA-Free Report) GPUs. Intel silicon is also in the mix
column22: but it doesn't take part in the real training work. Artificial intelligence comprises two main operations: training and inference with training being the more compute intensive. Inference can be handled by Intel CPUs
column23: Xilinx/Altera FPGAs
column24: NVIDIA GPUs
column25: ASICs like Google TPU and in some cases
column26: DSPs. Now Intel is planning to enter the training side very aggressively and hopefully it can stick with the timeline it has set.Based on its acquisition of startup Nervana last year
column27: Intel is building a new Xeon processor with Nervana integration. FPGAs are generally used as accelerators and we don't know yet if Intel will be using the FPGA technology it got through Nervana or Altera
column28: which it also picked up recently. At any rate
column29: Intel promises to deliver 100X the training speed current GPUs offer within three years
column30: which industry expert Patrick Moorhead says is aggressive. Intel expects the chips to start testing in mid-2017 and ship by year end.Fake News DramaFacebook (Nasdaq:FB-Free Report) and Google are being pressured by mainstream media (MSM) for influencing the public in favor of Trump. As ridiculous as this sounds
column31: there is a lot of print devoted to trying to prove them guilty.Google recently started employing artificial intelligence to support its search results that have until now been solely algorithm-based. But as luck would have it
column32: there was a brief period during which time 70news.wordpress.com took the top position
column33: fielding incorrect data on the number of votes earned by Clinton and Trump and claiming to have obtained the information from Twitter.The information was reportedly correct elsewhere on Google but this was enough to earn Google accusations for making money out of ""fake news."" So Google has said in a statement
column34: ""Moving forward
column35: we will restrict ad serving on pages that misrepresent
column36: misstate
column37: or conceal information about the publisher
column38: the publisher's content
column39: or the primary purpose of the web property."" It is hoped that the inability to generate revenue from fake news will make it harder to produce it.Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg has repeatedly said that 99% of the news sites posting on Facebook were authentic and that it didn't want to get into the position of arbiter of truth. ""We do not integrate or display ads in apps or sites containing content that is illegal
column40: misleading or deceptive
column41: which includes fake news
column42: said the Facebook statement (the company has now added the fake news part to pacify parties). Facebook also gave an assurance that it would continue to vet publishers to ensure compliance.Now See Our Private Investment IdeasWhile the above ideas are being shared with the public

column1: Ericsson (ERIC) to Provide Media Delivery Services for SBS;11/23/2016;"Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson (publ)ERICinked an exclusive contract to provide media delivery services for Australian public service broadcaster
column2: Special Broadcasting Service (""SBS"")
column3: fortifying its position as a leading provider of broadcast and media services in Australia and globally.Per the contract
column4: Ericsson will leverage its broadcast and media services hub in London to cumulate
column5: prepare and deliver content from multiple content owners and distributors globally. This content will be format ready for transmission and will be delivered directly to SBS's headquarters in Sydney.Further
column6: Ericsson will also provide Quality Control and deliver full technical metadata
column7: in accordance with SBS's technical and editorial specifications.This deal will enable SBS to transition from a manual delivery process to a digitised practice
column8: thus making its content aggregation process more efficient and streamlined. It will also lend SBS the flexibility and agility required to cater to the dynamic demands of managing media assets.As a leading global provider of broadcast and media services
column9: Ericsson has worked with world's most famous broadcasters
column10: platforms and content producers
column11: including BBC
column12: HBO
column13: 20th Century Fox
column14: Liberty Global
column15: Sky
column16: Bonnier Group
column17: TV5 Monde and France 24.In April this year
column18: Ericsson signed a multi-year access services contract with SBS to provide both live and file-based captions for SBS TV. Ericsson is one of the leading providers of closed captioning services in the world
column19: and boasts a strong presence in Australia
column20: the UK
column21: Germany
column22: France
column23: the Netherlands
column24: Spain and the U.S.ERICSSON LM ADR Price
column25: Consensus and EPS   SurpriseERICSSON LM ADR Price
column26: Consensus and EPS   Surprise|ERICSSON LM ADR QuoteWe believe that the new contract will not only help strengthen Ericsson's live captioning business in Australia
column27: but also boost its brand value in the global wireless equipment market.Of late
column28: Ericsson has been grappling with slumping demand in Russia and Brazil
column29: and accelerating negative industry trends have further compounded its problems. Further
column30: the company is also facing stiff competition from Huawei Technologies Co. and Nokia Corp.NOK. To combat such critical industry concerns
column31: Ericsson recently struck a partnership with Cisco Systems Inc.CSCO

column2: A.I.
column3: Self-Driving Cars and More;11/22/2016;"Last week was an exciting one with some rumors about Apple'sAAPLiPhone manufacturing in the U.S.
column4: Cisco'sCSCOearnings report
column5: Intel'sINTCfirst AI Day plus lots more.iPhone Manufacturing In The U.S.In June this year
column6: Apple requested its iPhone assemblers Pegatron and Foxconn to evaluate the feasibility of making the devices in the U.S. While Pegatron refused outright on cost considerations
column7: Foxconn has decided to do the job. The study is likely to show that the cost increase
column8: skill mismatch and supply chain problems (the supply chain is largely in Asia) would make this cost prohibitive.This would raise iPhone prices for consumers/squeeze Apple's margins. But the study will help Apple negotiate with the government
column9: which might agree to fund skill development and/or subsidize U.S.-made phones. If not
column10: Apple could introduce a luxury line of iPhones manufactured in the U.S. and try to set off the super normal profits on those with the increased cost of phones carrying the government import duty.Note that Apple is not the only smartphone maker saddled with the problem. So if all smartphones get more expensive
column11: Apple's market share may not be affected.Cisco Earnings ReportCisco's first quarter 2017 resultstopped the Zacks Consensus Estimateon both the top and bottom lines but the guidance disappointed. Switching remains a sore point for Cisco in a market increasingly favoring SDN networks and leveraging the cloud. So it's not surprising that this segment declined 7%. The company had greater success in security where both advanced threat (up 100%) and web security (up 60%) were strong.Intel A.I. DayAt its first Artificial Intelligence (AI) Day in San Francisco last week
column12: Intel announced bold plans to target the deep learning segment that is currently dominated by NVIDIANVDAGPUs. Intel silicon is also in the mix
column13: but it doesn't take part in the real training work. Artificial intelligence comprises two main operations: training and inference with training being the more compute intensive. Inference can be handled by Intel CPUs
column14: Xilinx/Altera FPGAs
column15: NVIDIA GPUs
column16: ASICs like Google TPU and in some cases
column17: DSPs. Now Intel is planning to enter the training side very aggressively and hopefully it can stick with the timeline it has set.Based on its acquisition of startup Nervana last year
column18: Intel is building a new Xeon processor with Nervana integration. FPGAs are generally used as accelerators and we don't know yet if Intel will be using the FPGA technology it got through Nervana or Altera
column19: which it also picked up recently. At any rate
column20: Intel promises to deliver 100X the training speed current GPUs offer within three years
column21: which industry expert Patrick Moorhead says is aggressive. Intel expects the chips to start testing in mid-2017 and ship by year end.Fake News DramaFacebookFBand Google are being pressured by mainstream media (MSM) for influencing the public in favor of Trump. As ridiculous as this sounds
column22: there is a lot of print devoted to trying to prove them guilty.Google recently started employing artificial intelligence to support its search results that have until now been solely algorithm-based. But as luck would have it
column23: there was a brief period during which time 70news.wordpress.com took the top position
column24: fielding incorrect data on the number of votes earned by Clinton and Trump and claiming to have obtained the information from Twitter.The information was reportedly correct elsewhere on Google but this was enough to earn Google accusations for making money out of ""fake news."" So Google has said in a statement
column25: ""Moving forward
column26: we will restrict ad serving on pages that misrepresent
column27: misstate
column28: or conceal information about the publisher
column29: the publisher's content
column30: or the primary purpose of the web property."" It is hoped that the inability to generate revenue from fake news will make it harder to produce it.Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg has repeatedly said that 99% of the news sites posting on Facebook were authentic and that it didn't want to get into the position of arbiter of truth. ""We do not integrate or display ads in apps or sites containing content that is illegal
column31: misleading or deceptive
column32: which includes fake news
column33: said the Facebook statement (the company has now added the fake news part to pacify parties). Facebook also gave an assurance that it would continue to vet publishers to ensure compliance.CompanyLast  1 MonthYTDAAPL+1.48%+16.83%FB-1.68%-2.33%GOOGL+0.49%+7.00%MSFT+2.25%+18.14%INTC+0.98%+16.85%CSCO-3.85%+13.64%AMZN+2.85%+7.08%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateIntel-Disney Drone Show: Intel
column34: in collaboration with Walt Disney Imagineering
column35: will be putting up a light show for guests at Disney Springs - the shopping
column36: dining and entertainment district of Walt Disney World Resort. The show will feature 300 Intel Shooting Star drones for the first time in the U.S. These are tiny drones made of styrofoam and plastics
column37: weighing 280 grams and bearing LED lights that can create over 4 billion color combinations and easily be programmed for any animation from a single computer. At the show
column38: the drones will operate with holiday music.Microsoft and the Wind: MicrosoftMSFThas agreed to buy 237 megawatts of capacity from Allianz Risk Transfer AG's Bloom Wind Project in Kansas and Black Hills Corp.'s Happy Jack and Silver Sage wind farms in Wyoming. Microsoft expects that its data centers will get about 44% of their electricity from wind
column39: solar and hydropower sources this year and 50% in two years. The company already has deals for 20 megawatts of solar power and 285 megawatts of wind
column40: according to the blog post.Goldman Sachs Upgrades Microsoft: GS analysts Heather Bellini and Heath Terry have upgraded Microsoft to Buy based on its current and prospective growth in cloud computing. The analysts believe that Microsoft with its increased focus on the cloud will benefit from the growth in public cloud spending
column41: which they estimate will go from $32 billion this year to $137 billion in 2020.Pixel Resellers Taken to Task: Google showed how much a technology company providing basic digital services controls our digital existence. Last week
column42: some people that had bought Pixel phones online for resale by a New Hampshire dealer at a markup had their accounts frozen for violation of terms of service. Since no one really reads these terms of service
column43: the measures came as such a shocker. Google
column44: which attempts to make the devices available to everyone at the same price
column45: has since restored the services (Gmail
column46: online photos and other) with a warning.Alibaba-backed Logistics Firm's U.S. IPO: Best Logistics
column47: in which AlibabaBABAowns a 22% stake
column48: is reportedly looking for a U.S. IPO early next year. The company is valued at $3 billion based on its latest funding round
column49: in which Alibaba

column51: SoftBank China Venture Capital

column53: Cainiao Network
column54: and the World Bank's private-sector investment arm
column55: International Finance Corp participated.Legal/RegulatoryRussians Fear Apple Call Logs: Russian provider of iPhone hacking tools
column56: Elcomsoft says that Apple maintains a call log of users' phone calls and other details in its iCloud for up to four months. Apple likely does this to help sync calls across devices
column57: but the storage of private information without explicit consent is problematic.Moreover
column58: in its data access guide for law enforcement
column59: Apple says that available iCloud information includes email logs and content
column60: text messages
column61: photos
column62: documents
column63: contacts
column64: calendars
column65: bookmarks and iOS device backups but doesn't mention call logs. While all iCloud data is encrypted once it's on the server and in transit
column66: Apple keeps the keys for iCloud accounts in its U.S. data centers.Amazon Sues Counterfeit Sellers: Following repeated complaints from different parties including Apple
column67: Amazon is taking action against companies acting as counterfeiters. Last week
column68: Amazon filed a couple of cases against sellers of training equipment (originally developed and patented by Fitness Anywhere and sold by third-parties) and against infringers of patented technology for forklift equipment.These actions aren't easy because first
column69: the patent holder has to be established
column70: second
column71: new counterfeiters crop up all the time and third
column72: Amazon
column73: given its size has millions of sellers
column74: so it's hard to track any one seller. So these actions are encouraging. Amazon's Chinese rival Alibaba also faces the same problem resulting in the alienation of some brands.New Technology/ProductsApple Considering AR Device: Bloomberg reports that Apple may be experimenting with a Google's Glass-like AR (augmented reality) device
column75: for which it has spoken to suppliers and ordered a small quantity of related components. But while Google
column76: Samsung
column77: Facebook and others have focused more on VR (virtual reality)
column78: Apple
column79: like Microsoft with its Hololens
column80: seems to be more interested in AR. In any event
column81: the device is not expected to launch until 2018 at the earliest.WhatsApp Video Calling: Facebook has launched fully-encrypted free video calling for all WhatsApp users across the world. While this obviously sweetens personal communications
column82: it also makes the app more attractive for business users. The recently-talked about job posting feature does the same thing. Facebook had promised to look at monetizing the app once the user base reached critical mass and the company seems to be doing just that.Amazon Family Plan: Similar to Apple

column85: although they do have the option of choosing an annual family membership for $149
column86: which then brings down the monthly cost to $12.42.While other music services offer unique experiences
column90: Amazon's service comes with Alexa so you can just ask her to do your bidding in choosing tracks albums
column92: or whatever else you may be in the mood for.Amazon Expands Home Services: Amazon nearly doubled its home services areas with 20 new additions last week. The company offers more than 1200 services such as lawn care
column95: home cleaning and more through this offering. Services are also offered when a customer buys some item from Amazon and needs someone to install it. TV wall-mounting
column96: house cleaning and furniture assembly are reportedly the most popular services at present.M&A and CollaborationsIntel Invests in Self-Driving Cars: At the Los Angeles Auto Show last Tuesday
column97: Intel said that it is putting in $250 million to support the development of self driving and other technology (connectivity
column102: safety and security) for cars all over the world. Intel has said that it is currently involved in 30 vehicle programs
column103: but that number would swell to 49 by 2020. Its order book is already pretty huge at a billion dollars
column104: but this is just the beginning.Intel and Google Get Closer: Google and Intel are deepening their relationship with the goal of pushing their respective technologies in the cloud. While Google needs to wrest share versus Amazon and Microsoft
column105: Intel would like to make inroads into the deep learning segment that NVIDIA dominates. The two companies have now decided to go for both product integration and joint marketing to push these efforts
column106: especially among big cloud customers. They have announced that the collaboration will include container management

column116: so users can get their cars warmed up and ready before they step into them. Or they can ask Alexa to lock the doors as they carry heavy grocery bags into the house.Google AMD: Google is one company that keeps all its options open. So on the one hand

column1: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Q1 Loss Widens; Revenues Miss;11/22/2016;"makeZacksArticleAd();Palo Alto Networks Inc.PANWreported lower-than-expected first quarter of fiscal 2017 results.Palo Alto Networks reported adjusted loss per share (excluding amortization and other one-time items but including stock-based compensation)
column2: on a proportionate tax basis
column3: of 58 cents. The figure was significantly higher than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a loss of 27 cents. The company had suffered a loss of 36 cents in the year-ago quarter.Quarter DetailsThough Palo Alto Networks' revenues of $398.1 million surged 34% year over year
column4: it missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $400 million. The year-over-year improvement in revenues was primarily backed by strength in the network security market
column5: a strong product lineup and deal wins.Product revenues jumped 11% to $163.8 million. The company saw a 57% surge in subscription and support revenues ($234.3 million). SaaS-based subscription revenues climbed 65% from the year-ago period. Support revenues increased 49% year over year.Geographically
column6: on a year-over-year basis
column7: revenues from the Americas increased 33% and represented 70% of total revenue. Europe
column8: the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) also went up 32%
column9: accounting for 18% of total revenue. Asia-Pacific was up 47% and brought in the balance.Also
column10: customer wins coupled with expansion of the existing customer base supported quarterly revenues. Moreover
column11: billings jumped 33% year over year to $516.9 million during the quarter.Palo Alto Networks' gross margin increased 120 basis points (bps) on a year-over-year basis to 74.6%
column12: primarily backed by growth in both product recurring subscription and support gross margins.The company reported an adjusted operating loss of $38.7 million
column13: which increased from a loss of $21.8 million suffered a year ago. GAAP operating loss during the quarter came in at $49.9 million compared with a loss of $32 million reported in the year-ago quarter. Higher operating expenses (up approximately 38.7% year over year) also impacted operating results.The company's adjusted net loss was $51.9 million
column14: wider than a loss of $31.6 million reported last year. On a GAAP basis
column15: net loss was $61.8 million compared with a loss of $39.9 million reported in the year-ago quarter.Palo Alto Networks exited the first quarter with cash
column16: cash equivalents and short-term investments of approximately $1.390 billion compared with $1.285 billion in the previous quarter.Receivables were $346.5 million compared with $348.7 million in the last quarter. Palo Alto Networks' balance sheet does not have any long-term debt. The company reported cash flow from operations of $203.3 million during the quarter. Free cash flow came in at $182.4 million during the quarter. During the quarter
column17: the company repurchased 340k shares worth $50 million.GuidanceFor the second quarter of fiscal 2017
column18: Palo Alto Networks expects revenues in the range of $426 million to $432 million
column19: up 27% to 29% year over year. The Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at $438 million. column1: Why Marathon Petroleum
column2: Arista Networks
column3: and Headwaters Jumped Today;11/21/2016;"The stock market climbed to new record highs on Monday
column4: spurred by big gains in the oil patch and ongoing optimism about   the financial industry. The Dow
column6: and Nasdaq all   reached new all-time high levels
column7: along with the small-cap   Russell 2000 and mid-cap S&P Midcap 400 indexes. Some stocks   did even better
column8: andMarathon Petroleum(NYSE: MPC)
column9: Arista Networks(NYSE: ANET)
column10: andHeadwaters(NYSE: HW) were some of the best performers today. Below
column11: we'll   look more closely at these stocks to tell you why they did so   well.Image source: Marathon Petroleum.Marathon gets some activist attentionMarathon Petroleum jumped 9% after activist investor Paul   Singer and his Elliott Management private equity company asked   the energy company to break itself into three different pieces.   Elliott Management
column12: which has about a 4% stake in Marathon   Petroleum
column13: sent a letter to the board of directors suggesting   that a strategic review might lead the company to split out its   retailing business into one entity
column14: its refinery assets into   another
column15: and its pipeline and storage assets into a third   separately traded investment vehicle. Marathon Petroleum issued a   statement responding to the letter
column16: saying that it has already   taken action along the same lines that Singer's company has   suggested but remains open to engaging with shareholders. Elliott   has a history of successfully persuading companies to take   actions to boost their share prices
column17: and investors are hopeful   that its efforts can lead to strong returns for Marathon as   well.makeArticleAd();Arista gets some trade reliefArista Networks finished up more than 7% after the networking   equipment company got a vote of approval from U.S. customs   authorities. Arista has been working to find ways around an order   from the International Trade Commission
column18: which prevented it from   importing products that rivalCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) had argued infringed on its intellectual property.   However
column19: Arista always believed that it could offer alternative   designs that accomplished the same purpose while avoiding any   infringement issues
column20: and the U.S. Customs and Border Protection   apparently agree that the design changes effectively limit the   scope of the import ban. Further litigation is possible
column21: but for   now
column22: investors are pleased that the solution appears to be taking   shape.Headwaters agrees to a mergerFinally
column23: Headwaters jumped 17%. The building products company   said Sunday that Australian peerBoralhad agreed to buy Headwaters in a cash deal worth about $2.6   billion
column24: with investors in Headwaters receiving $24.25 per share   in cash. Boral believes that the deal will be completed around   mid-2017
column25: and Boral CEO Mike Kane said that Headwaters'   businesses ""are highly complementary with Boral's existing U.S.   operations."" Some question whether an expected commercial   building boom in the U.S. will actually come to pass
column26: but   shareholders in Headwaters are benefiting from the current   optimism.10 stocks we like better than Marathon     PetroleumWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: The 10 Best S&P 500 Blue-Chip Dividend Stocks to Buy Now;11/21/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe odds of a Federal Reserve rate hike in December are only going up
column3: but even if the central bank pulls the trigger
column4: dividend stockswill always remain in style.Source:401(K) 2012 via Flickr (Modified)True
column5: they could come under price pressure because they compete with bonds for investor dollars
column6: but they typically don't stay down for long. It's not like we're looking at anything but the most minimal raise anyway.makeArticleAd();So while interest rates will go up
column7: they'll still be pitifully low. That's where superior dividend stocks come in. Names with solid track records of stable and in some rising dividends are under consideration for an equity income portfolio. If they can deliver above-average price appreciation too
column8: so much the better.Combine the two
column9: and you've got a market-beating total return engine.We searched theS&P 500to find these types of stocks. Mind you
column10: the benchmark index has a subpar dividend of its own
column11: at just 2.2%. It's easy to find stocks with higher yields
column12: but then
column13: a high yield can be a warning sign for a dividend payer. The highest-paying names in the S&P 500 all have issues that the market is rightly worried about.The 7 Best Dividend Stocks to Buy for 2017So we looked for the happy middle ground
column14: and that's how we arrived at the following list of dividend stocks to buy now. They're blue-chip picks with strong income streams
column15: good (but not dangerously great) yields and market-beating price potential.Top S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy #10: Wells Fargo (WFC)Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)WFC Dividend Yield:2.9%If there's a downside to the big price surge inWells Fargo & Co(NYSE:WFC) stock since the presidential election
column16: it's that the dividend has fallen below 3% for new money. Just don't forget that if a new administration removes a number of financial regulations
column17: WFC will have more room to hike its payout.Either way
column18: WFC's share price has recovered a good chunk of the selloff following its phony accounts scandal. Moreover
column19: despite its issues
column20: Wells Fargo remains a high-quality stock with heavy exposure to the U.S. economy. It's the nation's largest mortgage lender
column21: after all.That also means Wells is not dependent on Wall Street activities like investment banking and trading. That helps tamp down volatility in earnings.Shares are closing in on breakeven for the year-to-date. Even withnew restrictions placed on the bank
column22: overwhelmingly positive sentiment on the financial sector should allow WFC to turn positive for 2016 soon.Top S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy #9: Merck (MRK)Source:Ryan via Wikimedia (Modified)MRK Dividend Yield:3%Merck & Co.
column23: Inc.(NYSE:MRK) is on fire this year - at least for a stodgy ol' pharmaceutical giant.MRK shares are up 18% for the year-to-date even after cooling off from all-time highs. Add in the dividend
column24: and the total return easily tops 20%.The price surge has tamped down the yield for new money
column25: but MRK stock still looks to offer a market-beating combination of price appreciation and payouts.The pharma outfit is facing some patent losses
column26: but new drugs and acquisitions should make up for them. Lung-cancer drug Keytruda is a burgeoning blockbuster. Moreover

column1: 3 Things Barrick Gold Corporation Wants You to Know About Its Strategic Goals;11/21/2016;"Image source: Getty Images.Barrick Gold(NYSE: ABX) is in the midst of a major transformation. The gold   miner is moving away from a focus on growing gold production to   become a company that grows value. As part of that shift
column2: the   company set three strategic goals to pursue over the next five   years. With three-quarters of this year in the books
column3: here's   what President Kelvin Dushnisky had to say about its progress   during the company's recent quarterly conference call.makeArticleAd();Building new partnershipsBarrick Gold's first strategic goal is:[To have a] profound understanding of and commitment to the     idea that in the twenty-first century
column4: our core business is     building partnerships of real depth and trust with host     governments
column5: local communities
column6: NGOs
column7: indigenous people
column8: and     others.The company took an interesting step toward that goal in the   third quarter with Dushnisky noting that it announced a   ""strategic collaboration withCisco(NASDAQ: CSCO)  ... for the digital reinvention of our   business."" He said that the first step of this collaboration   would be ""a flagship digital operation at Cortez."" This   partnership will entail embedding digital technology throughout   the mine so that the company
column9: for example
column10: can get real-time   operational data to enhance decision making. In addition to that
column11: the company plans to automate equipment to increase productivity
column12: which when combined with predictive algorithms can improve   precision and speed.Barrick will also work with Cisco to transform its entire   mining business in the future
column13: with a focus on bringing digital   technology to all of its mines. This partnership will help the   company unlock value
column14: which will grow its free cash flow per   share while at the same time reducing its environmental impact
column15: allowing it to be more transparent with its local partners. In   essence
column16: this is the first step of many as the company works to   not only take its business into the 21st century
column17: but build   new partnerships to create value for all stakeholders.Improving marginsBarrick's second goal is:[T]o produce industry-leading margins by operating in a way     that is gold-price agnostic. Whatever the gold price
column18: we are     constantly pushing ourselves to reduce our costs by being the     first for productivity and efficiency.The company needs to take a series of smaller steps to become   gold-price agnostic. For 2016
column19: that meant setting a target ""to be   free cash flow breakeven at a gold price of $1
column20: 000 per ounce   after paying a dividend
column21: according to Dushnisky. However
column22: on the   call
column23: he noted that the company was ""on track to achieve that   goal with free cash flow breakeven of less than $1
column24: 000 per ounce""   as of the end of the quarter. Because it was ahead of schedule
column25: the company took full advantage of highergold pricesduring the third quarter and generated $674 million in free cash   flow
column26: which allowed it to repay nearly $500 million of debt.Image source: Getty Images.Strengthening the portfolioBarrick's final goal is:Superior portfolio management. We measure our production in     quality
column27: not quantity. While we produce fewer ounces than we     have in recent years
column28: we generate significantly more free cash     flow per share; indeed
column29: in 2015 we produced free cash flow for     the first time in four years. We will prioritize growing free     cash flow over growing ounces. And we will always assess     existing and new opportunities
column30: both internal and external
column31: with that goal in mind.To meet that aim in the near term
column32: Dushnisky noted that the   company ""further strengthened our capital allocation process
column33: and   we continue to maintain a 15% hurdle rate for new investments   using a $1
column34: 200 an ounce gold price."" This high bar means Barrick   will only invest in its best opportunities going forward. It also   suggests that the company will spend less capital since it will   no longer sanction projects that don't meet the higher hurdle   rate
column35: which will allow it to generate more free cash flow. That   gives the company more flexibility to push toward its   philosophical goal of being debt free while also returning more   capital to shareholders.Investor takeawayBarrick Gold's management team is transitioning the company to   a new way of thinking. That means using technology to reduce   costs
column36: which will improve its margins and cash flow. Furthermore
column37: the company no longer wants to be the biggest gold company by   volume but instead become the most profitable producer. Barrick   believes that this aim will enable it to create value for all   stakeholders in the years to come.10 stocks we like better than Barrick GoldWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Is Cisco Stock Worth Holding Through Its Transition?;11/21/2016;"Image source: Cisco.Cisco Systems Inc.(NASDAQ: CSCO) is certainly facing new hurdles

column4: after reporting mixed fiscal 2017   first-quarter earnings
column5: Cisco stockstill looks like it could be a strong contender for a spot in a   long-term oriented portfolio
column6: even in the face of its challenging   transition.Why the stock is down nowCisco reported fiscal 2017 Q1 earnings for the period ended   Oct. 29 on Nov. 16
column7: including sales of $12.4 billion (excluding   certain product categories that were sold in 2015)
column8: up 1% year   over year. GAAP earnings per share of $0.48 were 4% lower than a   year ago

column10: the company performed   reasonably well in the quarter compared to expectations. What led   to the 5% sell-off after earnings were released seems to be the   weaker-than-expected guidance for Q2. Because of weak orders from   service providers
column11: which Cisco management blames on uncertainty   in the economy and other macro-level trends
column12: revenue (excluding   the same segments as above) is expected to be 2% to 4% lower than   a year ago
column13: with EPS (GAAP) expected to be in the range of   $0.42 to $0.47
column14: which would be a 32% to 24% decline year over   year.Cisco's transformation in focusCisco Kelly Kramer said in the release:We executed well in Q1
column15: delivering profitable growth
column16: and     saw strong adoption of our subscription-based and software     offerings as we transition our business to a more recurring     revenue model. We will invest in key growth areas and continue     to focus on delivering shareholder value.Cisco seeks to become less reliant on hardware. Image     source: Cisco.The transition Kramer is speaking to is Cisco's attempt to   break out of the hardware and other traditional product   categories such as Switching and Data Center
column17: two segments   that had declining sales in the quarter. Instead
column18: Cisco believes   other areas of the business will lead future growth.There were highlights in Cisco's earnings
column19: such as NGN   routing
column20: Cisco's second largest segment
column21: which grew 6%; security
column22: which increased 11%; and deferred revenue
column23: which accounts for   subscription products and grew 12% year over year. Gross   margin expanded healthily during the quarter

column28: including:CloudLock:Provides protection from the cloud to the network to the     endpoint
column29: enhances Cisco's security portfolio and ""Security     Everywhere"" strategy
column30: and will help deliver more     cloud-based subscription services.ContainerX:Focuses on developing enterprise-class container     management technology that works across a range of     platforms.Heroik Labs:Does business under the name Worklife

column4: Disney Disappoints;11/18/2016;"The Dow racked up major gains over the week following increasingly positive sentiment over a Trump presidency. Financials strengthened as chances of a rate in December increased substantially. Meanwhile
column5: tech stocks trended downward for some time before returning to their winning ways.Oil prices
column6: and subsequently the sector's stocks
column7: continued to be guided on inventories data and chances of an output cut. Fed Chair Yellen indicated that a rate hike was around the corner.Last Week's PerformanceThe Dow increased 0.2% last Friday as investors continued to cheer Donald Trump's win in the Presidential election. The Dow registered gains for the fifth consecutive session and finished at an all-time record high for the second straight day. Investors continued to speculate that the Trump Presidency will boost economic growth and inflation through new policies including higher infrastructure spending and tax cuts.Such expectations raised chances of rate hike in the near-term. Separately
column8: Fed Vice Chairman Stanley Fischer also indicated that the central bank has started to believe that inflation rate in the U.S. is on the verge of picking up significantly
column9: which may result in a rate hike. This had a positive impact on financial stocks.The index gained around 5.4% over last week. This was the Dow's best weekly performance since Dec 2011. A surprise election result led investors to speculate that a Trump Presidency may boost the U.S. economy. Most of last week's gains came on the back of a rally in healthcare and financial stocks. While Clinton's defeat played the main role in boosting healthcare stocks
column10: rising expectations of a rate hike helped financial stocks surge.The DowThisWeekThe index gained 0.1% on Monday. Shares of FANG stocks also declined. These losses dragged the technology sector down

column13: which in turn has raised chances of a rate hike next month. column1: 4 Things Cisco's Management Wants You to Know;11/18/2016;"Image source: Cisco Systems.Cisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) beat analyst estimates when it reported its fiscal   first-quarter results on Nov. 16

column10: a disappointing outlook that sent   shares of the networking hardware giant tumbling.makeArticleAd();The details beyond the headline numbers are important. Cisco's   earnings conference call was packed with valuable pieces of data   that can help investors fully understand the company's results.   Here are four key quotes from management that stood out
column11: taken   from the transcript provided byThomson Reuters.Security continues to shineOne of Cisco's major growth initiatives is security
column12: a   business that has been growing at a double-digit rate in recent   quarters. Because the security business is shifting toward   subscriptions
column13: the 11% revenue growth Cisco reported during the   first quarter doesn't fully reflect how much progress the company   is making. CEO Chuck Robbins went into the details:Let me review a few areas of our business where our     innovation is driving momentum. First
column14: security. Our security     revenue grew 11%
column15: marking the fourth-consecutive quarter of     double-digit growth. We're driving more subscription-based     recurring business
column16: resulting in deferred revenue growth of     39%.That big jump in deferred revenue suggests that Cisco's   security business will continue growing at a rapid pace going   forward. Robbins also pointed out that Cisco is the only company   with security product revenue exceeding a $2 billion annual run   rate and growing at a double-digit pace. Acquisitions are driving   some of this growth
column17: but Cisco's strategy of offering integrated   security solutions appears to be working.Explaining the weak guidanceCisco's second-quarter guidance fell well short of   expectations
column18: with analysts expecting the company to grow sales.   Robbins discussed the one major factor behind the weak   guidance:I think if you just look at our guidance
column19: let me be clear.     It's predominantly the SP weakness and the overall CapEx     challenges that we've seen in SP. That business is largely     account driven. You can assume that we have done an account by     account by account analysis in that space and understand what's     going on there. Right now I think there are a unique set of     characteristics
column20: particularly in the SP space. You have the     overarching macro uncertainty in the economy
column21: which I think has     led to the SP CapEx weakness that's been reported all year by     the analysts
column22: as well as you have political and regulatory     environments that are somewhat uncertain
column23: both in the U.S. and     around the world.Product orders from service providers slumped 12% year over   year
column24: while every other customer group posted flat or positive   order growth. Macro-economic uncertainty
column25: something we've heard   from Cisco before
column26: is one component
column27: as is the uncertainty   created by the U.S. election. Robbins was optimistic that   President-elect Trump would enact business-friendly policies
column28: potentially reversing some of these headwinds. But the company is   not modeling any improvement
column29: thus the weak guidance.The shift to subscriptionsSecurity isn't the only segment where a shift to subscription   and recurring revenue is hurting near-term results. When asked by   an analyst about the exact impact of this shift
column30: CFO Kelly Kramer   laid out the details:I'd say it's a couple points for sure impact on our growth     and it's a combination of -- its largely been historically     collaboration and security and Meraki
column31: but we are continuing to     add on our core platform with our Cisco ONE suite
column32: like I     mentioned last quarter
column33: which that is now being recognized     ratable where a year ago
column34: we would have recognized that as a     perpetual license sale. For example
column35: just using Cisco ONE as an     example in this quarter
column36: it would have been a point and a half     just on that if we had recognized it perpetually like we had a     year ago.Moving toward a recurring revenue model should make revenue   more predictable
column37: but for now
column38: it's hurting Cisco's top-line   numbers. Revenue that was once recognized all at once is being   spread out over time. In the near term
column39: this shift makes Cisco's   results look worse than they really are. However
column40: even adjusting   for the negative impact of the subscription shift
column41: Cisco's   guidance still calls for a sales decline.RepatriationWith President-elect Donald Trump promising to allow companies   holding cash overseas to bring it back into the country at a 10%   tax rate
column42: Cisco's mountain of overseas cash may finally be put to   good use. Kramer outlined the company's priorities:Just high level
column43: as you could imagine
column44: we have many
column45: many     scenarios of what we would do when repatriation comes
column46: which is     a combination of obviously we would ring fence in our debt and     then we would have a blend of actions we can certainly take     with our dividend
column47: as well as our share buyback
column48: as well as     leading flexibility for us to be able to do M&A and     strategic investments. It'd be a combination of all those     things. Obviously
column49: we listen very closely to our shareholders     and how we want to do that and we recognize it will certainly     give us a lot more flexibility.At the end of the first quarter
column50: Cisco had about $71 billion   of cash and investments on its balance sheet
column51: along with $34.8   billion of debt. Borrowing costs are low for Cisco
column52: with the   company paying just $198 million in interest during the first   quarter. But some debt reduction is likely.I suspect a major boost to the buyback would be in the cards   in the event of repatriation. Cisco may also raise its dividend   more than it would have otherwise
column53: or implement a special   one-time dividend. This is all speculation at this point
column54: but I   think it's safe to say that the company would return some of that   cash to shareholders.10 stocks we like better than Cisco SystemsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: First Solar
column2: Inc. (FSLR) Stock Can Fight Through the Pain;11/18/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThese are certainly stormy times in the solar sector. In what seems like a repeat of events that occurred just a few years ago
column4: the clouds are blocking any sunshine from reaching stocks in the sector. And those clouds have affected everyone form smaller panel players to industry stalwarts likeFirst Solar
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:FSLR). For FSLR stock
column6: the pain is hitting deep.Source:U.S. Department of the Interior via FlickrAfter reporting abysmal earnings
column7: the solar panel and grid-scale project firm is going back to the drawing board and restructuring itself to survive the near-term pain.makeArticleAd();While the crash in its shares yesterday hurt (and it's continuing to fall today)
column8: in the long run that restructuring might bare some serious fruit.As I said last time
column9: FSLR stock is very much a long-term play.The Clouds Get Darker at First SolarNo one likes waking up to a 13% decline after hours
column10: only to see an additional 11% decline when the bell finally opens. Such was the case yesterday when First Solar shareholders fired-up their brokerage accounts yesterday morning. Overnight
column11: the solar firm managed to fuel some fears that all is not right with the sector. Today
column12: shares are still tumbling downward with a 4% drop in early morning trading.7 Stocks to Buy From the Scrap HeapOver the last year
column13: solar stocks likeSunPower Corporation(NASDAQ:SPWR) andTrina Solar Limited (ADR)(NYSE:TSL) have been trending down thanks to an old foe. A sheer glut of panels.We've been down this road before as the solar industry often falls victim to supply gluts. Rather an abundance of new panels hitting the market
column14: demand is really the cause for the supply glut. China's demand of new solar panels and projects has fallen by the wayside. That has caused panel prices to crater.For FSLR stock
column15: the price drop in solar modules has already begun to hurt its bottom line. During its latest earnings release
column16: First Solar saw its revenues decline by 45% and it was forced to walk away from some money losing
column17: utility scale solar projects. That's a big deal as those grid-scale projects are really its bread-n-butter. FSLR was also forced to cut its guidance for the rest of 2016 and 2017.But apparently
column18: it wasn't enough.Thanks to the continued glut of panels and recent unfavorable operating environment - *cough* Trump's presidential win - First Solar has taken the chainsaw to its business and has announced a massive restructuring effort to ""kick the can"" until the sun shines again.Losses at FSLR for a Whole YearFirst Solar has been a superstar in terms of panel efficiency. As a result
column19: its modules capture more sun and are better at turning that sunshine into electricity. The problem is they are more expensive to buy. With prices so darn low for regular panels
column20: it doesn't make much sense for solar project developers to use FSLR's better panels. As a result
column21: First Solar announced plans to produce cheaper panels that aren't as good.But the firm has hit a road block. The glut has gotten worse and one of the cheaper designs is now too expensive.FLSR has now abandoned plans for the Series 5 product and will bring its production of its Series 6 modules to the market earlier. However
column22: that is still a full year away. In the meantime
column23: its Series 4 modules will continue production and slowly phase out until the newer cheaper panels are on the market.What does it really mean? Somebig time charges and losses for the firm. FSLR now expects a loss per share of $2 to $4 this year. Just a few weeks ago
column24: it had guided to profits of $3.75 to $3.90 per share. Those losses come from cutting 1
column25: 200 jobs and realizing pretax restructuring charges of $500 million to $700 million during the fourth quarter.More importantly
column26: the mid-term outlook isn't good either as First Solar now estimates that it will see lower revenues and panel shipments during all of 2017. It didn't give any profit estimates for the new year.Keep in mind
column27: FSLR already lowered its outlook when it reported earnings last time.Look Longer-Term for FSLR StockThe continued panel price decline and major charges at First Solar are certainly troubling. Not only for FSLR stock
column28: but the entire industry. And for some pure-panel players
column29: it could be their death knell. But for First Solar
column30: this could be a real opportunity for investors.It's Time to Rethink How We Value Cisco     Systems
column31: Inc. (CSCO) StockThe key to remember is that First Solar's main focus is those grid-scale projects. The bulk of FSLR's customer base is still utilities and major power providers - not mom 'n' pop rooftop firms likeSolarCity Corp(NASDAQ:SCTY). A major utility has a different set of mandates. And thanks to regulation and tax advantages
column32: when they commit to a project
column33: it usually gets done. That's where FSLR stock will shine long-term.The roll-out of its newer cheaper panels will only help push more power producers into First Solar's hands. The charges hurt today - very much so - but they also show that FSLR is willing it do what it takes to keep its competitive advantage.The Bottom Line: If you have a longer-term timeline
column34: the drop in First Solar shares might be a great time to snag some and put them away for a while. Solar has always been a long-term game and the recent moves by FSLR are insuring that it it'll be around to play that game in the next decade.As of this writing
column35: Aaron Levitt did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Pharma Stocks Under President     Trump7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Due for a     ReckoningThe postFirst Solar
column36: Inc. (FSLR) Stock Can Fight Through the Painappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWhileWal-Mart Stores
column3: Inc.(NYSE:WMT) andTarget Corporation(NYSE:TGT) are considered the ""Coke and Pepsi"" of modern discount retail
column4: they're not nearly as similar as most people think.Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)For one thing
column5: WMT generates much more volume per quarter
column6: about $120 billion
column7: than TGT generates in a year
column8: about $70 billion.makeArticleAd();Target's results are also choppier. It had a great Christmas last year
column9: but a massive theft of customer data by hackers in 2013 hampered results for years and resulted in a turnover of the executive suite.The history is also different. Walmart started as a discount chain
column10: while TGT is descended from the old Dayton's department stores
column11: which were eventually merged with Marshall Field's and spun out in 2004. Target is generally more corporate than WMT
column12: which is still run in the image of entrepreneurial founder Sam Walton.Target stock is riskier
column13: but its smaller size means it can change strategies quickly. The company has changed its strategy lately
column14: under new CEO Brian Cornell
column15: and investors need to understand the changes before buying Target stock.TGT Is Becoming a City MouseEarly in 2016
column16: the big story at TGT was thatit was beating WMT in e-commerce. It integrated its online store with in-store pick-ups last Christmas
column17: growing online sales by 30%
column18: and was planning $2.5 billion of investments in technology by 2017.7 Stocks to Buy From the Scrap HeapAnalysts were initially skeptical of it's move
column19: and early results were poor
column20: but last Christmas made analysts believers of Target stock and the company is now considered an e-commerce leader.Cornell's latest move is even bigger. He's going to make TGT the City Mouse to Walmart's Country Mouse.Target plans to open hundreds of small-format stores
column21: mostly in large cities
column22: reshaping the company's image and real estate footprint in the process.WMT CEO Doug McMillon had tried something similar starting in 2014
column23: opening Neighborhood Markets and planning Walmart Express stores built around gas stations
column24: but Walmart abandoned the plan this year
column25: closing 269 outlets.The difference between the two plans lies in where the small stores are
column26: and who they are aiming at.While the Walmart Neighborhood Markets were in suburbs
column27: and represented in-fill between larger Walmart SuperCenters
column28: the new TGT stores arein the center of cities
column29: and in college towns
column30: highlighted by a 45
column31: 000 square-foot unit in Tribeca
column32: in lower Manhattan.While the Neighborhood Markets were also smaller
column33: cookie-cutter versions of WMT's larger outlets
column34: heavy on the groceries and mostly self-service
column35: the new Target stores are customized to their neighborhoods and the company is investing heavily in its supply chain to get the specific goods each location needs.Bottom Line on Target StockIt's the planned adaptation to local tastes - and the back-end supply chain needed to fulfill those needs - that is going to determine whether this plan succeeds.In setting his sights on urban life
column36: Cornell is going after a growth market and taking advantage of TGT's smaller size
column37: relative to Walmart. The question is whether the chain's discount image can handle the shift
column38: and whether it can deliver prices that are below those of other retailers in urban cores.It's Time to Rethink How We Value Cisco     Systems
column39: Inc. (CSCO) StockIf Cornell can make this work then Target stock becomes a real threat to stores likeWhole Foods Market
column40: Inc.(NASDAQ:WFM) on the grocery side andMacy's Inc(NYSE:M) on the retail end. These high-end merchants have focused on urban markets to maintain margins
column41: and TGT is threatening to cut them.Another question is whether urban consumers will flock to a store called Target. Cornell thinks they will
column42: because many urban newcomers are families with small children
column43: not the singles and young marrieds who moved intown in previous decades.Such consumers may be looking for bargains. If they are
column44: and if Target can integrate its e-commerce efforts neatly into such stores
column45: the company's stock could be in for big gains.If you're willing to take a bigger risk for a possibly great reward
column46: look to Target. If you're mainly looking for yield and relative safety
column47: you're a WMT shopper.Dana   Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. His latest novel   isBridget O'Flynn vs. Something Big & Ugly.Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing
column48: he did not hold a position in any of the   aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Pharma Stocks Under President     Trump7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Due for a     ReckoningThe postTarget Corporation (TGT) Stock Looks Even Better With Urban Strategyappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Ericsson (ERIC) Inks Multi-Year Deal with 20th Century Fox;11/17/2016;"Telefonaktiebolaget LM Ericsson (publ)ERICtook a significant step in expanding its subscription video on demand (""VOD"") service - Nuvu - as it signed a deal with leading international content distributor
column2: 20th Century Fox Television Distribution.Ericsson's Nuvu is an end-to-end subscription VOD service
column3: spanning both the technology platform and the content licensing
column4: developed for mobile operators in emerging markets. Nuvu leverages on the company's extensive capabilities based on Ericsson Managed Player and components of Ericsson MediaFirst TV Platform.Nuvu is collaborating with some of Africa's leading mobile phone operators to deliver a unique content and technology solution to cater to the demands of consumers across sub-Saharan Africa. The partnership with 20th Century Fox will enable Nuvu to offer subscribers some of Hollywood's finest films as part of their package.The exclusive
column5: multi-year feature film deal will give Ericsson access to 20th Century Fox-produced titles
column6: as well as a wide selection of global film franchises
column7: intended for territories across sub-Saharan Africa in multiple languages. The output will include titles likeDawn of the Planet of the Apes
column8: The Devil Wears Prada
column9: The Monument Men
column10: The Maze Runner
column11: Rio 2
column12: The Fault in Our StarsandKingsman: The Secret Service
column13: in addition to film franchises
column14: such asX-MenandDie Hard.For a monthly subscription fee
column15: consumers will acquire unlimited access to an initial 3
column16: 000 local and international premium titles from a range of genres.Further
column17: the service will have a built-in ability to distribute content to users during off-peak periods
column18: which will serve to lower data costs for both operator and consumer. This feature would tackle a key issue which was hindering VOD uptake in Africa. column46: while operating margin is anticipated between 29% and 30% for the quarter.Our TakeThe modest first-quarter results and the disappointing guidance will weigh on the stock price in the near term. Intensifying competition from several smaller players

column1: 3 Tech Stocks That Belong in Every Portfolio;11/17/2016;"Image source: Getty Images.Volatility and high-flying valuations are tech stock   characteristics that cause some investors to avoid the sector   entirely. However
column2: that's painting with too broad a brush -- and   a good way to miss out on some of the best opportunities on the   market. While the dangers inherent to buying stocks priced for   high growth and the threat of disruption in the broader space   make some tech companies a poor fit for portfolios that aim to   minimize risk
column3: the sector also hosts standouts that any investor   should consider.makeArticleAd();With the goal of identifying tech stocks that deserve a spot   in any portfolio
column4: we asked three Motley Fool contributors to   spotlight their pick for a top stock in the space. Here's whyThe Priceline Group(NASDAQ: PCLN)
column5: Check Point Software Technologies(NASDAQ: CHKP)
column6: andCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO)  made the list.Ready for takeoffBrian Feroldi: For years I believed that The Priceline Group was   just another online travel site
column7: so I couldn't figure out why its   stock was always hitting new highs. That all changed in 2010
column8: when I was finally educated about the business. I've since come   to believe that this tech stock that belongs in every investor's   portfolio.The Priceline Group has transformed itself into a market   darling thanks to itstop-notch management team. The company has a long history of making smart acquisitions   that have helped to power its revenue and profits higher for   years on end.While you're probably already familiar with several of its   brands -- think Kayak
column9: Priceline
column10: OpenTable

column1: Here’s Why Target Corporation is Still a Buy (TGT);11/17/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsTarget Corporation(TGT) is the 3rd largest discount retailer in the United States based   on its $40 billion market cap.  OnlyCostco Wholesale Corporation(COST) andWal-Mart Stores
column3: Inc.(WMT) are larger.Target has increased its dividend payments for anamazing 45 consecutive years.  The company's long dividend streak shows that Target's   business is strong and stable enough to reward shareholders over   a wide variety of economic conditions.makeArticleAd();Target's dividend streak puts it in rarefied air.  Target   is one of only50 Dividend Aristocrats.  Dividend Aristocrats are S&P 500stocks with 25+ years of consecutive dividend increases.    Target just passed its ex-dividend date on November 14
column4: and   will pay out 60 cents per share on December 10th.TGT stock currently has a high 3.5% dividend yield and a   low price-to-earnings ratio of 13.4.  With that in mind is   now the time to buy Target?This article examines the investment prospects of Target.Historical Growth & Future Growth ProspectsTarget has managed to grow its dividend payments at a compound   rate of 19% a year over the last decade.  Earnings-per-share   have grown at a more pedestrian 5.6% a year over the same   period.At this point it's important to note that earnings-per-share   growth (relative to dividend growth) is a better measure of   underlying intrinsic value per share growthfor Target.  That's because Target's dividend growth is a function of   significantly increasing its payout ratio.A decade ago
column5: Target's payout ratio was around 15%.    Today
column6: the company's payout ratio is 42%.  It's impossible   for TGT to triple its payout ratio again over the next   decade.  Therefore
column7: Target's dividend growth is going to   slow.  I expect dividends to grow about in line with   earnings-per-share going forward.Target's earnings-per-share growth of 5.6% a year over the   last decade isn't great.  I'd put it in the 'mediocre   growth' category.  But here's the thing…TGT grew despite massive managerial missteps.Over the last decade
column8: TGT dealt with a botched expansion into   Canada
column9: a highly publicized data breach
column10: and the Great   Recession.  Despite all this
column11: the company still managed to   grow its earnings-per-share at 5.6% a year.The Best Investments for 2017Even if Target grows at 'just' ~5.5% a year over the next   decade
column12: investors will see solid total returns when you factor in   the company's dividend yield.  TGT's 3.5% dividend yield   combined with minimum 5.5% expected earnings-per-share growth   gives investors expected total returns of 9.0% a yearbefore valuation multiple changes…TGT Stock ValuationThere are two factors that - more than any other - determine   the probability of success of an investment:Are you investing in a high quality business?Are you investing in a business that is either fairly     valued or undervalued?Looking at Target's long-term dividend streak gives us a big   hint as to whether Target is a quality business.The company has a strong and durable competitive advantage   that has allowed it to increase its dividend payments for 45   consecutive years.Specifically
column13: TGT benefits from its large size.  In the   discount retail industry
column14: size matters.  Large businesses   benefit from economies of scale.  They pass these discounts   onto customers.  Low prices attract more customers
column15: making   the company even larger
column16: in a virtuous cycle.On top of that
column17: Target also has stores that are generally   perceived as cleaner and a bit more 'upscale' than rival   Wal-Mart.  The company's brand and reputation for   fashionable merchandise enhance the company's competitive   advantage.There's little doubt Target is a high quality business with a   shareholder friendly management… But is the company trading for   fair value?TGT currently has a price-to-earnings ratio of just   13.4.  The company's historical average price-to-earnings   ratio over the last decade is around 15.5.  Based on its own   historical average price-to-earnings ratio
column18: Target looks   undervalued at current prices.The company also looks (deeply) undervalued relative to the   S&P 500.  The S&P 500 is currently trading for a   price-to-earnings ratio of24.9.  Now ask yourself
column19: is Target significantly worse than the   'average' S&P 500 stock?I don't think so…  And yet
column20: the company trades for a   price-to-earnings ratio that is nearlyhalfthat of the S&P 500.Final Thoughts On Target's Investment ProspectsTarget has a long history of rewarding shareholders with   rising dividends.  The company went ex-dividend on November   14th - marking yet another dividend payment coming to   shareholders.  In addition to its high dividend yield
column21: Target also regularly repurchases its shares.  The company   has reduced its share count by around 15% over the last 5   years.Target's management is objectively shareholder friendly   judging by its dividends and share repurchases.  The company   has solid-if-not-spectacular expected growth as well.Even if Target manages to grow its earnings-per-share at just   5.5% a year
column22: investors can still expect total returns of 9% a   year at current prices
column23: thanks to Target's dividend yield.Cisco Systems
column24: Inc. (CSCO) Stock Is       Screeching to a HaltBut…  Actual investment returns are likely to be   higher.  That's because TGT appears undervalued at current   prices with its low 13.4 price-to-earnings ratio.Target is ranked as a Top 100 stockon the Dividend Manager Website (#8 overall)
column25: and also ranks in   the Top 25% of stocks usingThe 8 Rules of Dividend Investing.Dividend growth investors looking for exposure to the discount   retail industry should consider adding Target to their   portfolios.Article by Ben Reynolds

column1: Stock Futures Pull-Back on Bullish Econ Data;11/17/2016;"Stock futures were struggling to stay positive as Wall Street reacts to economic data that fuels expectations for the Federal Reserve to hike rates next month
column2: and braces for Fed Chair Janet Yellen's testimony to Congress. After a stunning seven-day winning streak
column3: the Dow Jones Industrial Average was poised to trade lower for a second day as the post-Election Day rally finally runs out of steam.Futures were cautiously higher before the 8:30ET data-dump and only slightly trimmed early gains on the pre-release of Yellen's testimony to the Joint Economic Committee. Contrary to past statements about monetary policy
column4: Yellen cautioned that waiting too long to raise rates could ""undermine financial stability""
column5: and that delaying increases in the Fed funds rate for too long could force the Fed to ""tighten policy relatively abruptly to keep the economy from significantly overshooting policy goals.""Her remarks were followed by economic data that gave the Fed the ammunition it needs to hike rates in December. Nominal CPI rose 0.4% while the core was up 0.1%
column6: jobless claims tumbled 19
column9: and housing starts soared 25% in October to a 9-year high of 1.323 million. Permits were also strong last month
column10: increasing 0.3% to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.229 million. The only miss to the downside was the Philadelphia Fed business outlook index to 7.6 in November from October's 9.7. This is
column11: however
column12: the fourth consecutive month the index has been positive.makeArticleAd();In corporate news
column13: Walmart (WMT) reported lower-than-expected comparable sales

column10: Inc. (AMGN)Amgen revealed that the company enjoyed a strong clinical   trial for itsmost recent medication.The biotechnology company tested erenumab
column11: which is a drug   designed to treat patients who suffer from migraine.   Administering 70 milligrams of the medication proved to be   successful.The second late-stage study of erenumab reduced the amount of   days per month in which patients were hit with a migraine every   month. Those who received the medication saw their migraines   reduce by 3.2 days.The Best Investments for 2017Meanwhile
column12: those on twice as much of the drug - 140 milligrams   - saw their migraine reduced by 3.7 days. The baseline that   patients were tested at was 8.3 migraine days per month when the   trial began.Erenumab is also designed to help prevent chronic migraine.   Amgen is helping to develop the injectable drug
column13: which was   administered once a month for six months on patients.AMGN shares gained 0.2% after the bell Wednesday.Cisco Systems
column14: Inc. (CSCO)It was a meek day for CSCO stock despite Ciscobeating its financial targetsin its most recent period.The company earned 61 cents per share on an adjusted basis in   its fiscal first quarter. The figure topped Wall Street's   expectations of 59 cents per share over the period.Cisco was also able to top revenue
column15: which analysts expected to   come in at $12.33 billion. Its net sales amounted to $12.4   billion over the course of the quarter.However
column16: the stock still suffered due to the fact that the   company predicts revenue will sink 2% to 4% year-over-year. Wall   Street was calling for a 2% increase in revenue compared to a   year ago.Cisco's wireless unit revenue last quarterfell 2%year-over-year to $632 million. The company is also slated to lay   off 5
column17: 500 workers from the first quarter.CSCO shares slipped 4.4% after hours yesterday.NetApp Inc. (NTAP)NetApp also had astrong earningsshowing yesterday.The company reported its earnings for its second quarter
column18: which amounted to 38 cents per share
column19: coming in one cent lower   than what it earned a year ago in the same period.On an adjusted basis excluding one-time items
column20: NetApp brought   in 60 cents per share
column21: which was also one cent lower than it was   a year ago. The consensus estimate called for earnings of 54   cents per share over the period.Analysts were also projecting revenue of $1.35 billion over   the three-month period
column22: and the company came just short   of this figure with net sales tallying up to $1.34 billion.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is Back in the       'Buy' Column!For its third quarter
column23: NetApp expects earnings to be in the   range of 41 cents per share to 46 cents per share. Revenue will   be between $1.325 billion and $1.475 billion.NTAP shares surged 10.8% after Wednesday's market close.As of this writing

column1: Growth Businesses Fall Short for Cisco Systems;11/16/2016;"Image source: Cisco Systems.Networking hardware giantCisco Systems(NASDAQ: CSCO) reported its fiscal first-quarter results after   the market closed on Nov. 16. The company's results came in at   the high end of its guidance
column2: but Cisco expects the second   quarter to be much weaker. Growth areas such as collaboration and   the data center suffered declines during the quarter
column3: while   security continued to post robust growth. Here's what investors   need to know about Cisco's first-quarter results.makeArticleAd();Cisco Systems results: The raw numbersMetricQ1 2017Q1 2016Year-Over-Year ChangeRevenue$12.35 billion$12.68 billion(2.6%)Net income$2.32 billion$2.43 billion(4.4%)Non-GAAP EPS$0.61$0.593.4%Data source: Cisco Systems.What happened with Cisco Systems this quarter?Adjusted for the sale of the SP Video CPE business
column4: Cisco's   revenue was in line with the high end of its guidance.Adjusted revenue grew by 1% year over year.The switching segment suffered a 7% decline in sales
column5: generating $3.72 billion of revenue.The routing segment produced $2.09 billion of revenue
column6: up     6%.The collaboration segment
column7: which has been growing in recent     quarters
column8: suffered a 3% sales decline
column9: with $1.08 billion of     revenue.Data center revenue dropped 3% to $834 million.Wireless revenue dropped 2% to $632 million.The security segment continued to grow at a double-digit     rate
column10: with revenue of $540 million representing growth of     11%.Service provider video
column11: excluding the SP Video CPE     business
column12: slumped 2% to $271 million.Deferred revenue rose 12% year over year to $17 billion
column13: driven by subscription-based software.Cisco's second-quarter guidance fell short of   expectations.Revenue is expected to decline by between 2% and 4%
column14: excluding the SP Video CPE business.GAAP EPS expected between $0.42 and $0.47
column15: while non-GAAP     EPS expected between $0.55 and $0.57. For the second quarter of     last year
column16: non-GAAP EPS came in at $0.57.What management had to sayCisco CEO Chuck Robbins summed up the quarter:We had a good quarter despite a challenging global business     environment and we performed well in our priority areas. We are     leading our customers in their digital transition by providing     them with highly secure
column17: automated
column18: and intelligent solutions     in the ways they want to consume them. Our innovation pipeline     is robust and we are well positioned for the future.Kelly Kramer
column19: CFO of Cisco
column20: discussed the shift to a   subscription model:We executed well in Q1 delivering profitable growth
column21: and saw     strong adoption of our subscription-based and software     offerings as we transition our business to a more recurring     revenue model. We will invest in key growth areas and continue     to focus on delivering shareholder value.Looking forwardOne thing hurting Cisco's results is its ongoing shift toward   a subscription business model. The security segment grew revenue   by 11% year over year
column22: but deferred revenue soared 39%. While   collaboration revenue slumped 3%
column23: deferred revenue jumped 14%.   Cisco singles out the growth of software-as-a-service within   these segments as one reason for the discrepancy.With only one growth business

column1: Nokia (NOK) Outlines Key Financial and Strategic Targets;11/16/2016;"Nokia CorporationNOKissued its financial and strategic outlook for the coming days at the Capital Markets Day presentation on Nov 14. Going forward
column2: the company plans to substantially increase its dividend as well as focus on reducing costs.Business OpportunitiesNokia insisted that it will seek to streamline its cost of sales. Notably
column3: the company has raised its cost savings guidance from EUR 1.2 billion to EUR 1.7 billion. It has also stated that it will look forward to invest in cable access markets as well as its enterprise businesses.Nokia has been witnessing significant synergies from its recent purchase of Alcatel-Lucent. The core focus areas for the combined entity is likely to be next-generation 5G wireless technology
column4: IP and software
column5: defined networking
column6: cloud-based solutions
column7: big data analytics
column8: and sensors and imaging.Also
column9: the merged entity can effectively leverage the emerging Internet of Things (IoT) platform and will be able to deliver competent triple-play voice
column10: video and data solutions globally. Also
column11: Nokia will be able to benefit from Alcatel-Lucent's strong foothold in China as well as its veritable client list
column12: which includes Verizon Communications Inc.VZand AT&T Inc.T.However
column13: Nokia expects its Networks business to decline in line with the primary addressable market in 2017. The company also expects operating margin to be in the range of 8%-10%. Intense competition from the likes of Cisco SystemsCSCOand drab market conditions are some of the major factors that are likely to hurt revenues. However
column14: revenues from Digital Health and Digital Media are expected to increase year over year in full-year 2017
column15: primarily supported by increased adoption of Digital Health and Digital Media products.Higher DividendsNokia also stated that it wants to raise its dividend payout by 40-70%. For the current year
column16: the company aims for a dividend per share of EUR 0.17
