column1: LinkedIn Corp (LNKD) Makes Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Look Savvy;10/28/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading     TipsIn retrospect
column3: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) may have timed its acquisition ofLinkedIn Corp(NYSE:LNKD) perfectly. If it had waited until after the release of its   solid third-quarter growth numbers following Thursday's closing   bell (bolstering solid second quarter growth   numbers)
column4: LNKD shares may have been priced too richly. Had it made the   deal prior tomid-June
column5: it may not have known what it was getting.Throw in the fact that LinkedIn isalso working on a data center infrastructurethat may well give Microsoft a way to compete with the likes ofCisco Systems
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO) andJuniper Networks
column7: Inc.(NYSE:JNPR)
column8: the acquisition may end up being even better than   anticipated.makeArticleAd();Either way
column9: one final look at LNKD stock as a standalone name   is merited.LinkedIn EarningsFor its fiscal third quarter of the year
column10: LinkedIn earned   $1.18 per share on $960 million worth of revenue. The top line   was slightly better than the expected $959 million
column11: but the   bottom line trounced expectations for a profit of only 91 cents   per share of LNKD stock. Revenue was up 23% year-over-year
column12: while   per-share operating earnings grew 51%
column13: extending what's become a   very respectable growth trend.Memberships at the professional networking site grew as well.   LinkedIn membership grew by 17 million to 467 million accounts   during the quarter in question
column14: up 18% on a year-over-year   basis.7 Growth Stocks That Should Replace Apple in       Your PortfolioPerhaps more important
column15: LinkedIn swung to a GAAP profit. Net   income of $9.1 million was the first quarterly profit the company   has turned in over a year
column16: and marks a wide turnaround from the   $46.9 million loss it booked for the third quarter of 2015.CEO Jeff Weiner commented ""In Q3
column17: continued product   investments across our platform drove another quarter of strong   engagement and financial performance. As we look forward
column18: our   combination with Microsoft creates the opportunity for us to   dramatically increase the impact and scale with which we deliver   value to our members and customers.""Between the trajectory LinkedIn is on and the potential   synergies a pairing of it and Microsoft could foster
column19: MSFT   investors have a lot to be smiling about today … even more   knowing the $26.2 billion price tag is locked in regardless of   how much more valuable LinkedIn may have just proved it was.Another Reason MSFT Stock Owners Should Smile?While the synergies between a business-oriented LinkedIn and   productivity-oriented Microsoft are clear
column20: one has to wonder if   there was more to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's decision to   purchase LNKD than just the leverage he could apply to LinkedIn's   membership.Although it's not a secret per se
column21: the work LinkedIn had been   doing in the arena was secretive. That work? Rather than purchase   an off-the-shelf hardware from names like Juniper and Cisco - and   be relatively beholden to their architecture and pricing -   LinkedIn hasopted to develop its own data center   architecture.While LinkedIn's project director Ali Kahn says the effort is   not for commercial purposes but rather to put LNKD in charge of   the experience it delivers
column22: the fact is
column23: this home-grown   solution
column24: which can be implemented at a fraction of the normal   cost
column25: presents a compelling possibility for Microsoft … even if   only to use for itself.The Last Word on LNKD StockMSFT is still paying something of a fortune for LinkedIn
column26: offering $196 in cash per share of LNKD stock as part of the deal   that is expected to be closed before the end of the year.   LinkedIn has only generated $3.43 billion in revenue for the past   twelve months
column27: and only turned a minimal GAAP profit in the most   recent of its last four quarters.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is Just Getting       StartedIt's not where LinkedIn is that really matters
column28: however. It's   where it's going. And where it's going is pretty impressive on   its own.As of the latest look
column29: LinkedIn was on pace to grow operating   earnings by 34% this year on a 26% growth rate in revenue. Next   year's earnings per share of LNKD (pre-merger) are projected to   be up 22% on a 20% improvement in sales
column30: And
column31: bear in mind   LinkedIn has a strong history of beats for the top and bottom   line.MSFT shareholders have a lot to look forward to
column32: as the   impending pairing should make LinkedIn's good and improving   numbers even better.As of this writing
column33: James Brumley did not hold a position     in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy That       Yield 4% or More7 Top Stocks to Buy for Months of Red-Hot       ReturnsThe postLinkedIn Corp (LNKD) Makes Microsoft Corporation   (MSFT) Look Savvyappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 9 Dividend Stocks to Buy Now;10/28/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIn an uncertain market there's a lot to be said for having a firm foundation ofdividend stocksfor your portfolio. A good income play at a good price isn't quite as sexy as a roaring momentum stock
column3: but over the long-term
column4: the reliable returns from dividends really add up.Source:401(K) 2012 via Flickr (Modified)Every investor needs to be biased toward income stocks right now - even if they are at or near retirement
column5: and looking to take some risk off the table. After all
column6: current yields are about 1.8% on T-Notes and just under 2.2% on investment-grade corporates.makeArticleAd();Where else are you going to get income?If you want stability
column7: then well-priced dividend stocks will provide a great backbone for your portfolio in 2017. And if you're looking for income
column8: you have to remember that even conservative bond funds still have interest rate risk and could lose principle value if and when the Federal Reserve raises rates in the coming month.In short
column9: there's no better place to put your money than dividend stocks right now.7 S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy That Yield     4% or MoreHere are nine great picks to consider:Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Seagate Technology (STX)Sector:Technology2016 Performance:-7% year-to-date vs. +4% for the S&P 500Market Cap:$10 billionCurrent Yield:7.4%Seagate Technology PLC(NYSE:STX) is one of the largest hard drive manufacturers in the world. Some investors are leery of a PC-focused business like Seagate
column10: but while the stock has flopped considerably from its 2014 highs
column11: it remains fairly valued with a forward price-to-earnings ratio of less than 10 and continues to hang tough in this mobile age.That bargain P/E comes even as Seagate has rallied strongly lately. Shares of STX bottomed at under $20 in mid-2016 and have been steadily on the march through the second half of the year. That momentum bodes very well for 2017.But more importantly
column12: who cares if the lion's share of the gains are behind us when Seagate is such an income powerhouse? STX is one of the biggest dividend plays on Wall Street
column13: with its 63-cent payout each quarter equaling a roughly 7.3% yield right now. And since the dividend is about 68% of next year's earnings
column14: it is very secure and not at risk of a cut.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Cisco Systems (CSCO)Sector:Technology2016 Performance:13%Market Cap:$148 billionCurrent Yield:3.4%Cisco Systems
column15: Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO) is not the tech powerhouse it once was
column16: but value investors can still find a lot to like in this enterprise technology leader.Chuck Robbins took over from longtime leader John Chambers as CEO in mid-2015
column17: and he has already started reshaping the company to be more agile. Although revenue is only set to grow by single digits in 2017
column18: earnings per share will jump 13%. This is in part thanks to efficiencies that include the painful decision to lay off20% of its workforcethis summer.Furthermore
column19: while top-line growth isn't burning down the house
column20: there is assuredly good growth ahead in the dividends of CSCO stock. Its payout has surged more than fourfold in five years
column21: from just 6 cents a quarter in 2011 to 26 cents currently. Even now
column22: the payouts are highly sustainable at less than half next year's earnings.7 Tech Stocks That Will Ride Healthcare to     RichesLooking forward
column23: Cisco continues to reshape its company via acquisitions including six deals in 2016 across everything from semiconductor designers to data center managers to cloud computing companies. This will position the company very nicely for success in the new year and beyond.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Caterpillar (CAT)Sector:Industrials2016 Performance:24%Market Cap:$48 billionCurrent Yield:3.7%You may think it's silly to consider any stock that has run up more than 20% in a year as a ""value"" play. But when you compare current pricing ofCaterpillar Inc.(NYSE:CAT) versus highs of about $110 in 2011
column24: 2012 and most recently in 2015
column25: you can see why this company isn't exactly going like gangbusters despite recent momentum.The thing holding back CAT stock during the last few years has been commodity prices
column26: of course. An ill-timed move into mining equipment via the 2011 acquisition ofBucyrus- at a massive premium
column27: no less - has ruined the company's performance since then. But it looks like we've hit a bottom in commodity prices as oil and gold have stabilized after long-term declines
column28: and that bodes well for Caterpillar.Investors piling in lately have noticed this
column29: but more important isa 12-month target price target from Goldman Sachs at $112- up big-time from a prior target of $76 that was long overdue for revision.A 3.5% dividend and hopes of continued economic recovery could also help this heavy equipment company power even higher
column30: but most important is the notion that the worst is over for CAT in terms of commodity prices and in terms of hangover from its snake-bitten 2011 buyout of Bucyrus.Invest with confidence here now that the worst is behind Caterpillar and momentum has returned in 2016 … even if the company still isn't quite back to where it was before.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: JPMorgan Chase (JPM)Sector:Financials2016 Performance:4%Market Cap:$250 billionCurrent Yield:2.8%It's rough out there for many financial stocks lately
column31: given the lack of confidence in the financial sector since the Great Recession and the increased scrutiny by regulators and politicians. ButJPMorgan Chase & Co.(NYSE:JPM) continues to stand strong amid the headwinds
column32: posting a string of better-than-expected earnings lately.That's admittedly thanks to cost-cutting measures
column33: but it also helps that JPM remains the largest bank in America with over $2.3 trillion in total assets. And while JPM isn't exactly known to be squeaky clean
column34: recent trouble atWells Fargo & Co(NYSE:WFC) makes it look much more principled by comparison and could help both investor sentiment and consumer perceptions of the bank.JPMorgan is one of the best-run operations out there
column35: weathering the financial crisis better than its peers and quickly ramping back its dividend to an attractive 2.8% yield at current pricing even though that payout remains just about one third of total earnings. The 4-cent dividend increase in 2016 was an increase of more than 9%
column36: and long-term value investors should expect to see another move like that in 2017.The Top 10 S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy     NowYes
column37: JPM had a rough start to 2016
column38: but it recently started to get its groove back and is once again challenging its previous 52-week highs. That could mean that a breakout soon in this financial stock.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Ventas (VTR)Sector:Real Estate2016 Performance:19%Market Cap:$24 billionCurrent Yield:4.4%Ventas
column39: Inc.(NYSE:VTR) is a real estate investment trust (REIT) that is capitalizing on the graying of America
column40: and is one of the largest operators of senior living facilities in the U.S. VTR owns approximately 1
column41: 300 properties
column42: ranging from skilled nursing facilities to specialty hospitals.While the long-term trend lifting Ventas is powerful
column43: you won't have to wait years for the profits to transpire. VTR stock has outperformed nicely in 2016
column44: and continues to power higher thanks to a great portfolio of properties and efficient operation.Almost half of Ventas' properties operate under the lucrative ""triple net lease"" model where tenants are responsible for paying real estate taxes
column45: building insurance and maintenance. That's a streamlined and cost-effective deal for the operator
column46: and VTR investors have been paid back nicely via a 4.4% dividend fueled by these properties.As baby boomers age and rely on facilities from companies like Ventas to keep them healthy and active
column47: there will only be increased demand for these kind of services in the coming years. That demographic shift makes VTR all but a sure thing no matter what turmoil strikes Wall Street in the next year or so.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Telefonica (TEF)Sector:Telecom2016 Performance:-10%Market Cap:$49 billionCurrent yield:6.3%Spanish telecommunications giantTelefonica S.A.(ADR)(NYSE:TEF) is not just a big player in Europe
column48: but also in Latin America.This emerging-market exposure has been a double-edged sword
column49: though
column50: because while it has allowed for big growth in some areas
column51: it also has caused headaches of late. But as Latin American markets like Brazil and Argentina have put up significant outperformance since spring 2016
column52: the future is once again bright for TEF stock.Beyond the 2017 outlook
column53: the longer-term prospects of emerging markets remain bright as growing middle class consumers increasingly turn to cell phones and mobile technology. And while Europe itself isn't exactly going bananas
column54: the economy on the continent has improved from the double-dip recession a few years ago. It's certainly much more stable.If you're looking for growth
column55: in all honesty
column56: TEF isn't going to really provide it. But with a big dividend and a fair price now that the telecom trades at just 12 times next year's earnings
column57: this pick is a great way to add an international flavor to your dividend stocks portfolio.10 Stocks That Every Investor Should OwnThe dividend is huge
column58: too
column59: at 6.3%. And while foreign stocks like this have payouts that can be volatile and only pay twice a year instead of quarterly - and while you have to consider foreign taxes on dividends as well - buy-and-hold investors will assuredly be well-served by this stable European telecom amid an otherwise uncertain outlook for 2017.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Ares Capital (ARCC)Sector:Financials2016 Performance:8%Market Cap:$5 billionCurrent Yield:9.9%Business development companies (BDCs) likeAres Capital Corporation(NASDAQ:ARCC) are popular options for investors chasing yield because these publicly traded stocks operate much like investment funds. When you buy in
column60: you are buying their portfolio of equity and debt investments.Since ARCC has a close relationship with private equity giantAres Management LP(NYSE:ARES)
column61: that means ready-made access to financing in some big-ticket deals. And while there is always risk in these loans
column62: both Q1 and Q2 numbers from Ares showed a marked improvement in non-performing loans compared with previous quarters.An additional plus is that Ares Capital is savvy about buying up smaller andsometimes even bigger rivals
column63: consolidating power while debt is relatively cheap in an effort to maximize its control of the market.Shares probably won't move much
column64: judging by the rangebound nature of this stock since 2010 after a snap-back from the Great Recession bottom. But with a yield approaching double digits
column65: who needs share appreciation from ARCC when you can get huge dividend checks each quarter?Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Chevron (CVX)Sector:Energy2016 Performance:12%Market Cap:$195 billionCurrent yield:4.1%Chevron Corporation(NYSE:CVX) is up 13% in 2016
column66: fighting back nicely from its spring lows when we saw crudeoil pricesbottom at under $27. But while Chevron has been riding a recovery in oil in 2016
column67: its outlook for 2017 remains bright.That's in part because OPEC continues to talk about production cuts in the coming months and into the New Year
column68: but also because of serious restructuring that included laying off 12% of Chevron's workforce in the wake of lower oil prices. This OPEC move will keep oil prices firm
column69: and the efficiencies will keep Chevron's costs low going forward.CVX also is in the middle of a largeasset saleto strengthen its balance sheet and improve its margins in the era of $50-per-barrel oil. In 2015
column70: Chevron sold $5.7 billion in assets and its goal for 2016 and into 2017 $5 billion to $10 billion in additional cash.This will not only support the business
column71: but also the company's nice 4.3% dividend yield.What Stocks Will Win the 2016 Election?CVX is not just one of the best performers in the Dow with a double-digit return in 2016
column72: but also one of the highest-yielding with this kind of yield. Chevron also just kept up its streak of consecutive annual dividend hikes byraising its payout
column73: albeit by a penny per share.Dividend Stocks to Buy Now: Mattel (MAT)Sector:Consumer Discretionary2016 Performance:16%Market Cap:$11 billionCurrent Yield:4.8%Surprised to see toymakerMattel
column74: Inc.(NASDAQ:MAT) on this list? Don't be - because since Mattel began paying dividends regularly in 2011
column75: it has boosted payouts 65% in just five years.Yes
column76: MAT stock fell on hard times in 2014 and 2015 as it plummeted over 50% peak-to-trough in part because of its biggest brands like Barbie and Fisher-Price falling out of favor - and
column77: of course
column78: because it lost the right to licenseWalt Disney Co(NYSE:DIS) princess toys. However
column79: the company implemented aggressive cost cutting measures and is now in the middle of a turnaround that appears to be taking shape quickly.In fact
column80: Mattel wasjust upgradedto a buy in September by Monness Crespi Hardt based on a turnaround in its core brands and better days ahead.With new products in the pipeline
column81: Christmas could be very strong for Mattel. So don't delay and buy this dividend payer while your yield is good and before prices rise.Jeff Reevesis the editor of InvestorPlace.com and the author   ofThe Frugal Investor's Guide to Finding Great Stocks. Write him ateditor@investorplace.comor follow him on Twitter via@JeffReevesIP.The post9 Dividend Stocks to Buy Nowappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Baidu Inc ADR (BIDU) Stock Has a Brighter Future Than You Think;10/28/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsBy most accounts
column3: Baidu Inc (ADR)(NASDAQ:BIDU) should be down today
column4: but it's not. BIDU stock is up
column5: and updecidedly
column6: gaining nearly 4% for the day so far.Source:Simone.Brunozzi Via FlickrYes
column7: the so-called ""Google of China"" beat its earnings estimates for the recently completed third quarter. But the bar was set low - the Chinese search engine still reported its first-ever decline in quarterly revenue
column8: and said things would get worse before they got better.makeArticleAd();The prod for the unlikely bullishness
column9: then?To a small degree
column10: hope that the headwind would be short-loved. To a larger degree
column11: Baidu is showing growth where it really counts.Baidu EarningsLast quarter
column12: the Chinese search engine (among other things)earned an impressive $1.49 per share
column13: versus expectations of only $1.08 per share of Baidu stock. Non-GAAP net income was up 6.3% on a year-over-year basis
column14: and sales of $2.74 billion topped estimates of $2.7 billion.The top line was still down almost 1%
column15: however -  the first time in the company's history year-over-year revenue has slipped.7 Growth Stocks That Should Replace Apple in     Your PortfolioBaidu's third-quarter sales struggle is largely a reflection of new internet advertising rules. These rules were put in place by Chinese regulators earlier this year after a young man sought information about treatment options for his particular cancer using the Baidu search engine. His search yielded an advertisement that wasn't clearly identified as such
column16: and as it turns out
column17: may not have been his best therapy choice. His death not only sparked outrage - it prodded sweeping changes in the way healthcare ads are handled in China.It was no small matter for Baidu
column18: and by extension
column19: it was no small matter for BIDU stock holders. Healthcare advertising up until that time accounted for roughly a fourth of the search engine's ad revenue. The number of advertisers Baidu served during the quarterfell 11% from a year-earlier
column20: to only 524
column21: 000.Encouraging News for BaiduAnd yet
column22: even beyond the impact of tighter regulations
column23: there's something of a silver lining to this particular cloud.As it turns out
column24: taking Qunar out of the picture
column25: Baidu's revenue actually grew nearly 7%.Qunar was partially owned by Baidu
column26: but last year essentiallyexchanged its stake in the online travel agent to a stake in rival OTACtrip.Com International Ltd (ADR)(NASDAQ:CTRP)
column27: putting Qunar in arguably better hands than it was in as part of the Baidu family. Although the echoes of that disruption are still ringing
column28: Ctrip and Baidu have maintained an amicable relationship. Baidu CEO Robin Li hopes that hands-off partnership with partially owned Ctrip.com will serve as the model for deals in the future.It's also noteworthy that BIDU continued to cultivate a strong mobile presence
column29: as China - just like the United States - is becoming a mostly mobile market.The evidence: The number of consumers that used Baidu's mobile search engine at least once per month grew 3% year-over-year
column30: to 660 million. Mobile map usage was up 7% last quarter. Perhaps more telling than any other measure of progress on the mobile front
column31: however
column32: is the 99% increase in the number of consumers that have activated Baidu's digital wallet.Along these lines
column33: some also suspect Li is looking to shed its stake in offline-to-offline outfitNuomi
column34: which has proven to be an expensive headache.Looking Ahead for BIDU StockIn spite of the encouraging progress on the mobile front
column35: Baidu conceded that new advertising rules would take a bigger toll in the quarter currently underway than they did in the prior quarter. The company anticipates Q4's revenue willroll in between $2.63 billion and $2.71 billion
column36: down anywhere from 2% to nearly 5% on a year-over-year basis. Analysts were collectively expecting $2.89 billion worth of sales for the fourth quarter.3 Big Stock Charts for Friday: Cisco Systems
column37: Inc. (CSCO)
column38: Amazon.com
column39: Inc. (AMZN) and Microsoft Corporation     (MSFT)That should be the worst of any headwind
column40: however. Li explained:""We expect the most pronounced impact on our business in the fourth quarter followed by recovery early next year.""In the meantime
column41: Baidu continues to cultivate its artificial intelligence project and self-driving cars. Those efforts aren't expected to add to the value of BIDU stock anytime soon
column42: but they will eventually.As of this writing
column43: James Brumley did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWhat Stocks Will Win the 2016 Election?The 10 Best ETFs on the PlanetThe postBaidu Inc ADR (BIDU) Stock Has a Brighter Future Than You Thinkappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: What's in the Cards for Five9 (FIVN) This Earnings Season?;10/27/2016;"Five9 Inc.FIVNis set to report third-quarter 2016 results on Nov 1. Last quarter
column2: the company posted a loss of 7 cents per share
column3: which was narrower than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a loss of 11 cents. Moreover
column4: the company has outperformed the Zacks Consensus Estimate in all of the four trailing quarters with an average positive surprise of 29.13%.Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.Factors to ConsiderFive9 offers a virtual contact center cloud platform that acts as a hub for interaction between clients and customers. This facilitates contact center operations focused on inbound or outbound customer interactions within a single unified architecture. The company offers software products such as workforce management
column5: speech recognition
column6: predictive dialer and voice applications.The cloud-based contact center solution industry has been witnessing growth over the past several quarters as organizations are looking for ways to minimize costs and improve customer support. We believe that Five9 has been capitalizing on this opportunity
column7: which should be reflected in its to-be-reported quarter.Furthermore
column8: the company's sustained focus on expanding its product portfolio will aid its top-line performance.However
column9: intensifying competition from small and large players like Cisco SystemsCSCOis likely to dent Five9's third-quarter performance.FIVE9 INC Price and EPS SurpriseFIVE9 INC Price and EPS Surprise|FIVE9 INC QuoteEarnings WhispersOur proven model does not conclusively show that Five9 is likely to beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate in the upcoming release. This is because a stock needs to have both a positiveEarnings ESPand a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)
column10: 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) for this to happen. Unfortunately
column11: that is not the case here as elaborated below.Zacks ESP:The Earnings ESP for Five9 is -10.00%. This is because the Most Accurate estimate stands at a loss of 11 cents while the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at a loss of 10 cents. Please check ourEarnings ESP Filterthat enables you to find stocks that are expected to come out with earnings surprises.Zacks Rank:Though Five9's Zacks Rank #1 increases the predictive power of ESP
column12: the company's negative ESP makes surprise prediction difficult.Note that we caution against stocks with Zacks Rank #4 or 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement
column13: especially when the company is seeing a negative estimate revisions momentum.Stocks to ConsiderHere are a couple of companies which

column1: Better Buy: Cisco Systems Inc. or Oracle Corporation?;10/26/2016;"Cisco(NASDAQ: CSCO) andOracle(NYSE: ORCL) are often considered dusty ""old tech"" stocks that   are owned for income instead of growth. But with the market   hovering near historic highs
column2: both stocks might appeal to   investors looking for more conservative plays that can weather   the eventual downturn. But is one of these plays better than the   other? Let's compare these companies' core strengths and   weaknesses to decide.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Cisco's strengths and weaknessesLast year
column3: nearly half of Cisco's revenue came from sales of   routers and switches . Both are slow-growth businesses -- router   sales fell 4% last year as switching sales stayed flat. Both   businesses face three major headwinds: sluggish enterprise   spending
column4: competition from cheaper rivals likeHuawei
column5: and the rise of cloud-based networking solutions reducing the   need for traditional routers and switches.To diversify away from those two businesses
column6: Cisco has   aggressively expanded into higher-growth markets like   cybersecurity and service provider video. However
column7: its   double-digit growth in those two markets isn't significantly   boosting its  overall revenue
column8: which is expected to rise   just 1% this year. Earnings
column9: boosted by buybacks
column10: are expected to   rise 3%.Oracle's strengths and weaknessesOracle's core businesses of database and hardware are also   slow-growth ones. Both businesses face similar headwinds as Cisco   -- weak enterprise spending
column11: macro headwinds
column12: and a market shift   toward more scalable cloud-based services.In response
column13: Oracle has been pivoting its aging businesses   toward cloud-as-a-service platforms. Last quarter
column14: Oracle's   combined cloud and on-premise software revenues
column15: which accounted   for  nearly 80% of its top line
column16: rose 5% annually to $6.8   billion. Total cloud revenues
column17: which include its SaaS (software   as a service)
column18: PaaS (platform as a service)
column19: and IaaS   (infrastructure as a service) platforms
column20: rose 59% to $969   million. But like Cisco
column21: that double-digit growth isn't   significantly boosting its total revenue or earnings
column22: which are   respectively expected to climb about 1.5% and 1% this year.Which stock is fundamentally cheaper?Cisco currently trades at 14 times earnings
column23: which is much   lower than the industry average of 25 for networking equipment   makers. Oracle has a P/E of 18
column24: which is also a discount to the   average P/E of 54 for the application software industry. Both   stocks also trade at a discount to the S&P 500's current P/E   of 25.Looking ahead
column25: analysts expect Cisco to grow its earnings by   9% annually over the next five years. That estimate gives it a   5-year PEG (price to earnings growth) ratio of 1.3. Oracle's   earnings are expected to rise about 8% per year during that same   period
column26: giving it a 5-year PEG ratio of 1.9. Since a PEG ratio   under 1 is considered ""cheap
column27: neither Cisco nor Oracle look   undervalued relative to their earnings growth potential -- but   Cisco looks cheaper.Dividends and buybacksCisco has hiked its dividend annually for five consecutive   years
column28: while Oracle has done the same for four. However
column29: Cisco's   forward yield of 3.5% is much higher than Oracle's 1.6% yield.   Over the past 12 months
column30: Cisco spent 38% of its free cash flow in   dividends
column31: while Oracle spent 20%. This indicates that Oracle has   more room to raise its dividend
column32: yet it pays a lower yield than   Cisco.However
column33: Oracle favors buybacks over dividends -- it spent 65%   of its FCF on buybacks over the past 12 months
column34: while Cisco only   spent 22%. Cisco's more conservative use of its FCF on dividends   and buybacks gives it more cash to pursue big acquisitions. Both   companies are heavily focused on inorganic growth -- Cisco   acquired (or announced plans to acquire) 11 companies over    the past 12 months
column35: while Oracle acquired nine smaller   players.The winner: CiscoCisco isn't an exciting stock
column36: but its lower valuation
column37: higher   dividend
column38: and preference for using its FCF on dividends and   acquisitions instead of buybacks makes it a better long-term play   in my book. Oracle isn't a terrible investment
column39: butplenty of other""mature tech"" companies have better upcoming catalysts and higher   dividends.A secret billion-dollar stock opportunityThe world's biggest tech company forgot to show you something
column40: but a few Wall Street analysts and the Fool didn't miss a beat:     There's a small company that's powering their brand-new gadgets     and the coming revolution in technology. And we think its stock     price has nearly unlimited room to run for early
column41: in-the-know     investors! To be one of them
column42: just click here.Leo Sunowns shares of Cisco Systems. The Motley Fool owns shares of     Oracle. The Motley Fool recommends Cisco Systems. Try any of     our Foolish newsletter servicesfree for 30 days. We Fools may not all hold the same opinions
column43: but we all     believe thatconsidering a diverse range of insightsmakes us better investors. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: 7 Top Stocks to Buy for Months of Red-Hot Returns;10/25/2016;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe last week of October is upon us. This is the homestretch
column3: folks.Source:Shan Sheehan via Flickr (Modified)When it comes to finding the top stocks to buy
column4: now is the time to hunt. Historically speaking
column5: October is one of the most volatile months of the year … but it sets the stage for a strong rally into year's end.makeArticleAd();This year
column6: the election
column7: constant talk about interest rates and a semi-positive earnings season (so far) have allowed investors to seemingly emerge from the month with fewer scratches than normal. From our perspective
column8: this is more likely to set the stage for a stronger rally in November and December as investors are starting to feel like they may miss out on the market's last push for 2016.What Stocks Will Win the 2016 Election?With that as the backdrop
column9: here are seven of the top stocks to buy that should outperform the rest of the market over the final two exciting months of the year:7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Netflix (NFLX)Netflix
column10: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX)knocked the cover off of the ballwith its earnings report a few weeks ago
column11: giving shares of NFLX a 25% jump in value.But that shouldn't be all that we see from Netflix stock for the rest of the year.Content and delivery are king
column12: which is why we're seeing so much M&A activity in the media sector of the market. Netflix is one of the originals in this area and has made it clear that it will invest big in this growing business. NFLX's second investment
column13: into global expansion
column14: is showing signs of growth
column15: and no other company has the groundwork laid out like Netflix.NFLX's surge moves it from a perfect test of its 20-month moving average to almost hitting new all-time highs. The test of the long-term support will get the technicians back on board after Netflix spent much of 2016 worrying investors.As much as it seems wrong
column16: sentiment is still pessimistic toward Netflix. Put simply
column17: much of Wall Street has been on the wrong side of this stock
column18: and now they're in for a long
column19: painful game of catch-up. As of today
column20: 51% of the analysts covering the stock have it ranked a buy - that's lower than theS&P 500average!Expect analysts to upgrade NFLX over the next few weeks when we see any dips in price.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Lockheed Martin (LMT)The market is ""buying the news"" afterLockheed Martin Corporation(NYSE:LMT) announced better-than-expected earnings results. From a fundamental perspective
column21: this is one one of the strongest earnings reports in Lockheed Martin's last five years
column22: fueling a significant move.The rally comes after LMT spent the past two weeks trading just below the key 200-day moving average. It was relatively clear that the market was ""selling the rumor"" ahead of the report (erroneously!)
column23: creating a post-earnings trading opportunity.Today's response to the positive report has resulted in a move back above the 200-day moving average and has brought the stock out of a technically oversold status
column24: helping shares rally.More significant is the recent pullback to the 50-week moving average
column25: the first since February of this year. This has been staunch support for the shares since the long-term bullish rally was put in place in 2013.The Top 10 S&P 500 Dividend Stocks to Buy     NowThe positive earnings report along with the positive fundamental story ofeither presidential candidate being bullish for defense stocksmakes Lockheed Martin a clear bull play. Our year-end target for LMT is well above $260.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: First Financial Bancorp (FFBC)Regional banks have been leading the market higher as the reality of higher interest rates is being factored into valuations. Per regional banks specifically
column26: higher rates mean better balance sheet activity and stronger valuations because they get their operating revenue from traditional banking business.First Financial Bancorp(NASDAQ:FFBC) is a smaller regional in the southwest Ohio area. The bank has been making moves to expand and brand over the last two years
column27: and that move has yielded results. The most recent quarter's earnings marked a second consecutive besting of analyst expectations after a year of disappointing or in-line results.Technically speaking
column28: FFBC is a leader in its sector and against the market
column29: returning 23% year-to-date and maintaining strong technical trends. Sentiment toward this market leader is negative
column30: indicating that the ""wall of worry"" is in place for shares to climb higher.Of the nine analysts tracking the stock
column31: zero have it ranked a buy. In other words
column32: we are likely to see upgraders as the fundamental story gets even better.Look for First Financial Bancorp to continue climbing the wall toward a price target of $24.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Cisco Systems (CSCO)The ""old school"" technology stocks continue to lead things higher as companies likeCisco Systems
column33: Inc.(NASDAQ:CSCO)
column34: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) are setting the pace for the new round of technology infrastructure. Networking giant Cisco has shed some of the fat from years ago and is emerging as a major contributor to the ""internet of things.""Cisco shares are up more than 15% for the year
column35: double that of their Nasdaq-100 brethren
column36: putting them in the relative-strength position that most investors should be looking for. CSCO is trading above key technical and trendline support as they head into the end of the year
column37: which will bolster their performance.Seasonality is strong for the Nasdaq-100
column38: as it outpaces the broader S&P 500 index through the months of November and December. Cisco only accounts for 3% of the weight of the index -Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) is about 14% on its own - but remains in the top 10 components. Sentiment toward Cisco is more positive than many of the stocks on our bullish list
column39: but not overdone to the point where the stock is considered ""crowded.""7 Tech Stocks That Will Ride Healthcare to     RichesFor now
column40: the trends and positive seasonality should continue to move Cisco in the right direction toward our target of $34.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Nordstrom (JWN)'Tis the season
column41: right? Eh
column42: more like ""maybe.""The holiday season this year is going to come down to execution
column43: andNordstrom
column44: Inc.(NYSE:JWN) has been setting the stage for some success. The trends we've seen in the retail sector have displayed a splintering of the sector into ""haves"" and ""have nots.""Nordstrom is a ""have.""JWN has been a relative-strength leader in a turnaround move that started earlier in the year with management changes. Now
column45: the stock is trying to break above March highs and regain the $55 level.The last earnings report gave investors some hope
column46: but there's a considerable level of pessimism toward Nordstrom stock
column47: so it's easy for the retailer to impress
column48: leading to higher stock prices. Short interest on JWN is a whopping 12 times the average daily volume
column49: signaling the potential for a short covering squeeze to drive prices higher.Similarly
column50: the analyst recommendations on Nordstrom are low
column51: with nine of 29 analysts covering the stock ranking it a buy.Nordstrom stock typically has a seasonal tailwind
column52: and this year looks no different as the higher-end retailers are likely to attract more buyers than the lower tier. Our models target a price for JWN above the $62 level before year-end.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Nvidia (NVDA)Every time we look
column53: Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) is hitting another short-term high and still remains on our model's bull list. The semiconductor sector is booming
column54: despite flat PC business
column55: because we're putting all of those chips in devices in our hands and cars
column56: and TVs
column57: and video games. This is the market that Nvidia serves
column58: which is why it continues to push higher.Earnings on the chip manufacturer are coming up on Nov. 10
column59: but the last few days have looked like earnings bolstered the shares asTesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) andRambus Inc.(NASDAQ:RMBS) announced deals with the company. Shares continue to trade higher as we see the bearish investors that have been betting against the stock build the wall of worry.Short sellers are against the stock by 6.6 times the average daily volume of Nvidia shares
column60: and only 51% of the analyst community rates the stock a buy. Keep in mind that NVDA stock is trading higher by 115% year-to-date (that's not a typo).7 Stocks to Buy That Will Grow by Double     DigitsLook for earnings in early November to produce another short squeeze and upgrades that will push Nvidia Corporation toward a target of $78 or higher.7 Top Stocks to Buy for Red-Hot Returns: Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB)Finally
column61: we look at another regional bank that appears ready to roll higher as the fundamental and technical picture improve.Fifth Third Bancorp(NASDAQ:FITB)
column62: another southwest Ohio regional bank (though larger than First Financial)
column63: should also benefit from the interest-rate environment. FITB already has been operating with improving margins as it adopts newer technology. Now
column64: the balance sheet effect of higher rates should improve the bank's fundamental outlook.Fifth Third shares are trading above their 50-day trendline
column65: which is also trending higher. This bullish technical indicator provides a bullish forecast for the bank's shares over the next three to six months. Like Nvidia
column66: FITB shares have been ignored by the analyst community despite the positive operating environment of even a single rate hike. Currently
column67: a mere eight of the 31 analysts covering the stock have it ranked a buy.Fifth Third spent the past week rallying as its earnings report came out in line with analyst expectations. Those earnings garnered one price-target increase
column68: but it's still early in the season.Shares recently bounced off of long-term support from their 20-month moving average
column69: which is also the line of demarcation between a bull and bear market trend for a stock. Long-term trends and a positive fundamental environment has us targeting $24.50 on FITB shares.As of this writing
column70: Johnson Research Group did not hold a   position in any of the aforementioned securities.The post7 Top Stocks to Buy for Months of Red-Hot Returnsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Better Buy: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. vs. Cisco Systems Inc.;10/25/2016;"Though both stocks are up year to date
column2: HP Enterprise(NYSE: HPE) andCisco(NASDAQ: CSCO) shareholders have had a bumpy ride in the last   month or so
column3: with shares declining 6% and 4%
column4: respectively. Rumor   has it that HP Enterprise will announce additional job cuts
column5: though a spokesperson said its simply following through with its   existing restructuring plan.Cisco is also going through a transformation
column6: which explains   its own round of layoffs that began this quarter. As many as   5
column7: 500 employees
column8: equal to 7% of Cisco's global workforce
column9: will be   let go. Neither Cisco's nor HP Enterprise's realignments are   surprising given their push to expand in the cloud and Internet   of Things (IoT) markets
column10: but that hasn't prevented investors from   getting antsy.The upside is the recent share-price declines have made both   HP Enterprise and Cisco even better investment opportunities
column11: making the question of which is the better buy almost a   toss-up.makeArticleAd();Image source: Cisco.Why Cisco is a good buyDespite perceptions to the contrary
column12: Cisco's decision to pare   its workforce isn't purely about cutting overhead. The objective   is to shift resources away from what Cisco refers to as ""lower   growth areas"" so it can ""further invest in key priority areas   such as security
column13: IoT
column14: collaboration
column15: next generation data center   and cloud.""Impressively
column16: even in the midst of Cisco's business   transition
column17: it's still performing admirably
column18: particularly in the   key areas that will drive future growth. Excluding Cisco's   ""other"" unit and its now-divested SP video business
column19: last fiscal   year's best-performing divisions are a snapshot of CEO Chuck   Robbins' strategic plan.Security revenue climbed 13% in fiscal 2016 compared to a   year-ago to $1.97 billion
column20: and its collaboration unit -- its   third-largest revenue source behind only legacy routers and   switches -- increased 9% to $4.45 billion. Toss in the $3.7   billion in data center sales
column21: much of which is cloud-related
column22: and   Cisco is already delivering where it counts. And Cisco's 3.5%   dividend yield doesn't hurt either.Image source: HP   Enterprise.Why HP Enterprise is a good buyChange isn't always viewed favorably by investors
column23: but the   significant restructuring of HP Enterprise should prove to be a   win-win before long. CEO Meg Whitman got the ball rolling earlier   this year when she announced the tax-free spinoff and merger of   HP Enterprise's second-largest unit -- enterprise services --   withComputer Sciences Corp.The $8.5 billion deal with CSC includes a 50% stake in the new   ""pure-play"" powerhouse
column24: a $1.5 billion cash dividend
column25: and HP   Enterprise will rid itself of $2.5 billion in debt. For an   encore
column26: HP Enterprise also announced a similar deal for its   ""non-core software assets"" with U.K.-basedMicro Focus. The $8.8 billion merger with Micro Focus also includes an   ownership stake of 50.1% for HP Enterprise shareholders
column27: along   with a $2.5 billion one-time payment for Whitman and team.By the end of March 2017 -- the expected closing dates of the   mergers -- HP Enterprise shareholders will own shares of three   separate entities
column28: pocket a nice dividend
column29: and Whitman will be   closer to her strategy of ""creating a faster-growing
column30: higher-margin
column31: stronger cash flow company."" Enterprise services   did generate $4.7 billion in revenue last quarter
column32: but it was   also HP Enterprise's lowest margin unit by a wide margin
column33: and   software was its worst-performing division.Shedding businesses not related to HP Enterprise's core   competencies will help it focus on what it does best: delivering   Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) in the cloud. This year
column34: IaaS   is expected to become a $294 billion market
column35: easily making it the   cloud's largest segment
column36: and HP Enterprise is poised to garner   its share.HP Enterprise and Cisco both offer tremendous upside in   fast-growing markets
column37: but the latter's stellar 3.5% dividend   yield makes it the better buy for growth and income investors.   But when it comes strictly to appreciation potential
column38: a leaner   more focused HP Enterprise gets the nod.A secret billion-dollar stock opportunityThe world's biggest tech company forgot to show you something
column39: but a few Wall Street analysts and the Fool didn't miss a beat:     There's a small company that's powering their brand-new gadgets     and the coming revolution in technology. And we think its stock     price has nearly unlimited room to run for early in-the-know     investors! To be one of them

column17: which spans multiple jurisdictions. column18: the company's expanding cloud services have also helped it to capture big customers.Cloud's Prospects Remain StrongAccording to a study by non-profit association CompTIA released last month
column19: most companies are continuing to make major investments related to the cloud. More than 90% of the companies surveyed utilized some form of cloud computing. However
column20: businesses are also becoming more selective in the kind of cloud technology which are they choosing adopt.Meanwhile
column21: the primary motivation behind adopting cloud computing technology is the associated cost reduction. The survey revealed that 44% of medium businesses
column22: 47% of larger companies and 41% of the small businesses which were part of the survey believed that cost reduction was a more important reason for implementing cloud technologies compared with others
column23: such as increased speed
column24: lesser complexity and modernization.The most encouraging finding of the survey was that most of these companies were utilizing cloud solutions for a period of one to five years. Of these
column25: only 6% were using such solutions for five years. In contrast
column26: 23% of the companies were using such solutions for a period lesser than a year. This indicates that despite signs that the cloud market may be maturing; the sector's growth potential remains intact.Our ChoicesThe fact that Azure's performance is a major reason for Microsoft's encouraging results serves to underscore the growing importance of the cloud computing market. column1: 3 Things to Look For When Barrick Gold Reports Q3 Earnings;10/24/2016;"Image source: Getty Images.Barrick Gold(NYSE: ABX)  is set to release its third-quarter earnings on   Oct. 26. With earnings season upon us
column2: are you finding yourself   interested but equally worried about drowning in a flood of facts   and figures? It's not uncommon during this time of year. Let's   prepare by keying in on three things we can expect management to   address in its report.Rumor has itUndoubtedly
column3: management will pay considerable attention to one   of the company's priorities for 2016: improving its balance   sheet. Through the first half of 2016
column4: Barrick has paid down $968   million of its debt -- nearly half of its fiscal 2016 debt   reduction goal of $2 billion. So keep an eye on further progress   made in the recent quarter toward achieving that target. But theamountof debt may not be the only point of interest.makeArticleAd();Also look for management to address the mining industry's   speculation that Barrick is seeking to sell its 64% equity stake   in Acacia -- valued at approximately $1.9 billion -- to help   finance its debt reduction strategy. Management has made it clear   that it's willing to sell its non-core assets to help pay down   its debt
column5: but it hasn't revealed any specific deals.Forecasting improved performance in 2016
column6: management expects   to profit from Acacia even if it remains in the company's   portfolio. In Barrick's 40-F from 2015
column7: management forecast 2016   gold production to fall between 480
column8: 000 ounces and 500
column9: 000 ounces   -- a year-over-year improvement from the 468
column10: 000 ounces of   production in 2015. In addition
column11: the company expects to further   benefit from a reduction in costs. Whereas all-in sustaining   costs totaled $1
column12: 112 per gold ounce in 2015 at the Acacia mine
column13: management expects this figure to fall between $950 and $980 per   gold ounce in 2016.Lucky number sixBesides reducing its debt
column14: one of Barrick's priorities for   2016 is to improve its free cash flow. In fact
column15: it has set the   ambitious target of generating free cash flow per share even if   theprice of   goldwere to fall to $1
column16: 000 per ounce.Through the first half of the year -- during which the average   spot price of gold was $1
column17: 221 per ounce -- the company has   performed well
column18: reporting $455 million in free cash flow.Image source: Getty Images.In fact
column19: the second quarter of 2016 marked the fifth   consecutive quarter in which Barrick has reported free cash flow.   And with the price of gold hovering around $1
column20: 300 per ounce in   the third quarter
column21: expect Barrick to improve its streak to six   consecutive quarters.Management attributes its free cash flow growth
column22: in large   part
column23: to its ability to consistently lower capital expenditures;   however
column24: on the Q2 conference call
column25: it indicated that capex   spending will rise in the second half of the year. And this won't   be the only factor compromising free cash flow growth. Barrick's   CFO
column26: Catherine Raw
column27: stated on the call that the third quarter is   expected to be the highest in terms of all-in sustaining costs   for the year.Elaboration on digitizationLastly
column28: investors should expect management to address   Barrick's recent partnership withCisco(NASDAQ: CSCO) to -- as stated in the press release -- ""drive   Barrick's digital reinvention."" Working together at the Cortez   mine in Nevada
column29: the two companies will deploy sensing technology   throughout the mine to produce real-time operational data.The digitization of the Cortez mine is expected to improve not   only environmental and safety performance but also   the management of energy
column30: water
column31: and emissions. Consistent   with management's long-term vision for the company
column32: the digital   reinvention of Barrick is meant ""to help Barrick deliver on its   vision of growing free cash flow per share over the long   term.""During the Q2 earnings presentation
column33: management provided   improved full-year guidance for Cortez
column34: estimating the mine's   AISC to fall between $520 and $550 per ounce. It will be   interesting to see if management further improves upon the   guidance in light of the partnership with Cisco and when it   expects to deploy this technology at any of its other mines.The takeawayWith its eyes on reducing debt and growing free cash flow
column35: Barrick's management is clearly working to secure the company's   long-term success
column36: and I'd be surprised if the company's   third-quarter earnings don't reflect the fruits of this labor.   Though there may be a slowdown in the rate at which the company   is growing free cash flow
column37: I expect the company to remain on   track to achieve its goal of reducing debt by $2 billion for   2016.One additional thing I'll be looking for is an update on the   temporary closure of the company's Veladero mine. Though it had   initially suggested that the closure wouldn't have a material   impact on the company's earnings
column38: management has not recently   reaffirmed this position
column39: so it'll be interesting to see if   management provides further commentary.A secret billion-dollar stock opportunityThe world's biggest tech company forgot to show you something

column1: Juniper Earnings Preview: Services To Drive Revenue Growth
column2: Improve Profitability;10/24/2016;"Juniper Networks(JNPR) is scheduled to announce its Q3 results after market close on October 25th. The company expects roughly flat revenues over the year-ago period at $1.25 billion with the gross margin compressing by around a percentage point to 63%
column3: as shown in the table below. Margins are expected to be slightly lower than 2015 levels
column4: primarily due to pricing pressure for product sales leading to lower gross margins for the products division.In the first half of the year
column5: Juniper experienced a 3% annual decline in product sales to $1.62 billion. Moreover
column6: the gross margin of the product division compressed by 140 basis points over the comparable prior-year period
column7: mainly due to elevated pricing pressure on products
column8: especially in the EMEA region. Within the product division
column9: Juniper witnessed strength in the Switching business
column10: with revenues growing by double digits in Q2 both year over year and sequentially. Strong demand for Switching products was driven by telecom customers and the government sector. Moreover
column11: the newly introduced QFX 10K platforms are expected to drive revenue growth in the latter half of the year.makeArticleAd();On the other hand
column12: Services revenues were up 13% year over year in the same period. Growth was driven by the company's cloud-enabled brand solution that allows enterprise customers and managed service providers to provide on-demand cloud services. Additionally
column13: the improvement in Services gross margin was impacted by timing of spare parts purchases in previous quarters.As a result
column14: Juniper management has taken measures to restrict growth in its operating expenses over the last two quarters. The company aims to improve its cost structure such that its operating expenses for the third quarter fall by 7% y-o-y to around $500 million. This is likely to further improve operating profit for the company.Have more questions about Juniper? See the links below:Services To Drive Juniper's Top Line Growth In     Coming YearsJuniper's Q2 Earnings: How The Company's     Retaliating Against The Industry WeaknessHow Has Juniper's Revenue Composition Change In The Last Five   years?What's Juniper's Revenue Composition In Terms Of Different   Products & Services?Notes:1) The purpose of these analyses is to help readers focus on a few important things. column11: businesses are also becoming more selective in the kind of cloud technology which are they choosing adopt.Meanwhile
column12: the primary motivation behind adopting cloud computing technology is the associated cost reduction. The survey revealed that 44% of medium businesses
column13: 47% of larger companies and 41% of the small businesses which were part of the survey believed that cost reduction was a more important reason for implementing cloud technologies compared with others
column14: such as increased speed
column15: lesser complexity and modernization.The most encouraging finding of the survey was that most of these companies were utilizing cloud solutions for a period of one to five years. Of these
column16: only 6% were using such solutions for five years. In contrast
column17: 23% of the companies were using such solutions for a period lesser than a year. This indicates that despite signs that the cloud market may be maturing; the sector's growth potential remains intact.Our ChoicesThe fact that Azure's performance is a major reason for Microsoft's encouraging results serves to underscore the growing importance of the cloud computing market. Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column18: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column19: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column20: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column21: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
